loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Kadiatu from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has six children.

For the past five years Kadiatu has run a small pharmacy in her community, working throughout the week from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient funds to expand it.

Kadiatu is applying for a 700,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more drugs for her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to enlarge her venture and educate her children. In the future she plans to continue expanding her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more drugs for her business.

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en:
Anna Mary is a hardworking, married woman. She has two children, and she lives in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in produce, such as rice, beans and maize flour. She has been in business since 2006. She desires to expand her business into new markets. In addition, she wants to set up a food store that can sustainably supply her customers, all year round. Debtors and fluctuating prices affect her business growth. Her personal goals are to educate her children up to the University level, and to build a permanent house for her residence.

Anna Mary intends to use this loan to buy more beans, maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to restock beans, maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has four children.  For the past 20 years, Aminata has had her palm oil business at her house. She began her business because she could generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet Ramatu, She is in her late thirties and is from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has two children.  For the past 20 years, Ramatu has had her palm oil business alongside local food at her house. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Telsa Isabel

texts.es:
Telsa Isabel tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en la zona rural de Morropon, donde su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura a dos horas de la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia tiene una pequeña bodega donde ofrecen abarrotes y venta de plásticos, Telsa ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles, para capital de trabajo incrementar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes arroz, leche azúcar y de esta manera abastecer a sus clientes que a la vez son sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Telsa Isabel is 44 years old, and lives with her family in the rural area of Morropon. Her community is dedicated to commerce and agriculture, and is located two hours from the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Telsa Isabel has a small corner store where she sells groceries and plastic items. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Soles to fund her working capital needs and improve her business with the purchase of rice, milk, and sugar. In this way, she is able to serve her clients who are also her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries: rice, milk and sugar

loans.name: Tania Teresa

texts.es:
Tania Teresa tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en Morropon a dos horas de la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú, su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, además de conocido por su clima cálido.

Junto a su familia tienen una pequeña bodega de abarrotes y cerveza, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas y enlatados y de esta manera tener un negocio surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes, esto le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Tania Teresa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and children in Morropon, two hours from the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is dedicated to commerce and agriculture, and is known for its warm climate. 

Tania Teresa has a small corner store from which she sells groceries and beer. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Soles to invest in the purchase of vegetables, fruit, and canned goods. By doing so, she will be able to stock her business and offer her clients what they want, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор рыночный предприниматель из Мелитополя. В небольших городках как этот многие идут работать на рынок, открывая свой маленький торговый бизнес, чтобы прокормить себя и семью. Виктор один из таких бизнесменов. Начинал он с малого, а теперь уже имеет 3 торговых точки, на него работают 2 реализатора. Виктор торгует спортивной и классической мужской обувью.
Имея несколько точек реализации, Виктору необходимо все заполнить их товаром, чтобы привлечь покупателя. Для этой цели ему необходима сумма в 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы оптом закупить сезонную спортивную обувь на продажу.
texts.en: Viktor is a market trader from Melitopol. In small cities many people go to work in markets, opening a small trading business, so that they can support themselves and their family. Viktor is one of these businessmen. He began small and now has three retail outlets employing two salespeople. Viktor sells sports and classic men's shoes. With a few sales locations, Viktor must fill their inventory to attract buyers. For this goal, he requires the sum of 30000 Hryvnia for the wholesale purchase of sports shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal sports footwear to sale.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara has been involved in clothing sales for about 15 years. Years of experience and loyal clientele have helped her run her business very effectively and provide for herself and her family needs. 

Tamara is planning to use additional funds of 30,000 Grivnas to purchase women’s clothing merchandise for seasonal sale. To be more specific, she is planning to purchase blouses, sweaters and fleece jackets.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, sweaters and fleece jackets for sale.

loans.name: Yelizaveta

texts.en:
Yelizaveta is from Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. She has two grown children. Yelizaveta lives with her husband. She works as a cook at a social charitable institution. 

Yelizaveta is asking for a loan of 7,000 Grivnas for personal use. She is hoping to use the finances to remake the individual heating system in her house. Yelizaveta is planning to change the water heating unit and all the necessary pipes, too, and replace them with new ones. 

As the heating season has started in Ukraine, she doesn’t want to pay extra for consuming too much natural gas to heat the house. Therefore, the new heating system is the best possible solution.

loans.use: to remake the heating system in her house.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya lives in Drogobych. She sells embroidered shirts and blouses, towels, flower garlands and embroidery accessories, i.e. beads, embroidery patterns and yarn. She has been running this business for 18 years. Her two vending kiosks are located at a big local market that is very popular among the locals.  
Mariya turned to KIVA for assistance of 5,000 Grivnas to purchase candles and fabric for embroidery. This type of merchandise has become very popular these days and sells very well. Mariya is hoping to sell purchased merchandise and re-invest the income in her business.

loans.use: to purchase candles and fabric for embroidery

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella ya que el esposo esta en el exterior; vive en casa ocupando tres habitaciones con pisos de machimbre, la casa se encuentra en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, pero el esposo que vive en el extranjero es quien le manda dinero para la manutención de sus hijos

El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de dos habitaciones en su casa y darlas en alquiler y obtener un ingreso mensual extra  ya que lo que el esposo le manda no le alcanza para su subsistencia de ella ni de su familia

El sueño de Fanny es poder mejorar su negocio de venta de cosméticos y que su esposo se venga para Bolivia y pueda juntar a su familia

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Fanny is married and has three children who depend on her because her husband is abroad. She lives in a three-bedroom-house with tongue and groove wooden floors.  The house is located in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, she works selling cosmetics. Her husband is living abroad but sends her money for child support.

The loans is needed for the renovation of two rooms in her home and make them available for rent so that she can get an extra monthly income because what her husband sends her is not enough to sustain her and her family.

Fanny's dream is to improve her business at selling cosmetics, that her husband would come to Bolivia, and that the family would be reunited.
It’s the third time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the renovation of  two rooms in her home so that she can make them rentable to increase her monthly income.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, esta casada y tiene tres hijos todos ellos independientes,ocupa 5 habitaciones en su casa la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de calzados para niños, los cuales los comercializa en  Santa Cruz cada tres meses, generando sus ingresos de subsistencia de esta manera.

El crédito que requiere es para aumentar su capital y comprar más calzados de niños ya que por época de navidad tiene que surtir su mercadería y no perder clientela.

El sueño de Nancy es poder reunir un buen capital para su vejez y poder vivir sin trabajar en el futuro

Es la decima terceravez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la quinta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has three children, all of whom are now independent. She occupies 5 rooms in her house, which is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone of the city of La Paz. She currently makes a living from the sale of children's footwear, which she sells in Santa Cruz every three months, generating her means of income in this way.

The loan she requires is to increase her capital and to buy more children's shoes. Because of Christmas she needs to a larger amount of merchandise to avoid losing customers.

Nancy's dream is to accumulate a good amount of capital for her old age to be able to live without working in the future. This is the third time she is requesting a loan with IMPRO and the fifth time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more children's shoes.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a married woman who has four children. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in produce, such as rice, beans and groundnuts. She has been in business since 2005. She started the business after realizing that farming on a small piece of land, alone, was not profitable. So she started buying farm products from other farmers to sell, and the business became profitable.

Price fluctuations and the high cost of transport pose challenges to her business growth, while her desire is to own a food store in town. Harriet is requesting a loan to buy beans, groundnuts and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts and rice to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is requesting a loan to buy another hair drier. She is an ambitious woman, living in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a salon, where she mainly offers beauty services to women. The business is very lucrative. Christine also sells second-hand clothes, to supplement her income.

A lack of capital to buy modern machines, and customers not paying on time, are challenges that affect her business growth. Her desire is to own a beauty parlor in the city, one day.

loans.use: to buy another hair drier

loans.name: Masaratu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Masaratu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children.  In 2012, Masaratu established her hot rub business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Masaratu requires a loan in order to buy different kinds of pain rub and hot rub to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future; Masaratu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of pain rub and hot rub to expand her business.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la zona rural de Polvazal, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicada en la Región Piura, esta región está rodeada de desiertos, algarrobos, cerros y sabanas tropicales con un clima de yunga de la costa norte del Perú.

El es muy conocido en la zona, desde hace 10 años se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de frejol caupi y maíz, teniendo como punto de venta todo el distrito de Buenos Aires empezando toda la margen derecha por lo que en la actualidad cuenta con clientela fija en la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para dar mantenimiento sus cultivos comprando fertilizantes y así tener una mejor cosecha y además ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Elio, 32, lives in the rural area of Polvazal, where the residents work in agriculture and commerce.  It's in Morropón, in the Piura area, located on the northern coast of Peru and surrounded by desert, carob trees, hills, and savannah with a hot tropical valley climate.

Elio's very well known in the area.  He has grown and sold black-eyed peas and corn for 10 years.  He sells throughout the Buenos Aires district, beginning on the right bank where he has steady customers.

He has requested a loan for 3,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy fertilizer to take care of his crops and have a better harvest as well as additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la comunidad La Matanza, que se caracteriza por el comercio de alimentos preparados con ingredientes de la zona, agricultura, este distrito pertenece a Morropon a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia emprendedora que se dedican a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza, y piqueos, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Rebeca ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para capital de trabajo, con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de bebidas energizantes, gaseosas y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the community of La Matanza. This region is known for agriculture and food preparation with local ingredients. La Matanza belongs to Morropon, two hours away from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. 

Rebeca's family is very entrepreneurial, and dedicates itself to the sale of chicha (a local corn drink), beer, and snacks. The business is located in the family's home. Rebeca has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 Soles loan for working capital, with which she will buy soda and energy drinks. By doing so, she will be able to offer her clients a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy soda and energy drinks

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kumba from Waterloo2,  the East End of Freetown. She is married and blessed with 9 children.  She began her business because she wants to improve her family'sliving  conditions. In 2008, Kumba established her general stock business.  She works at the business 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Kumba requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, cookies, drinks and filtered water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Kumba plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, cookies, drinks and filtered water.

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Sama from Waterloo 2, eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with two children.  

In 2001, Sama established her food business. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a transportation problem.

Sama requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava, vegetables and potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Sama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, vegetables and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has seven children.  In 2010, Aminata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wants to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a poor road network.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children.  In 2000, Aminata established her local food business. She began her business because she generates her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and transportation problems.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more cassava, bananas, and potatoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future.  Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, bananas, and potatoes to expand her business

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Isha from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Her children are currently attending school. In 2011, Isha established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isha requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Isha plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child age 2 years. She began her business because she wants to improve her family. In 2007, Ramatu established her general stock business. She works at the business 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Ramatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase general stock items for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda  de 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la compra de cerdos. Actualmente, vive con sus tres hijos de edades, entre 10 a 23 años y su esposo, quienes le ayudan en los oficios domésticos.

Yolanda se dedica a la compra de cerdos, para venderlos ya faenados, desde hace 8 años, así les da un valor agregado extra y es de esa forma que ha salido adelante, ya que su hijo mayor es su mano derecha en los negocios. Además, cuenta con un comedor en la Ciudad que lo administra junto con su hijo de 23 años.

Con el préstamo estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda comprar mas cerdos; ya que el mercado de consumidores cada vez, le exija más, porque la carne de cerdo es muy consumida en diferentes platillos.

Yolanda quiere tener un negocio muy fuerte en la zona, y así ser más competitiva en el mercado y obtener más ingresos del comercio de carne de cerdo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 41 years old, very hardworking, and dedicates herself to raising pigs. She currently lives with her three children, who are between 10 and 23 years old, who help her with household chores. 

Yolanda buys pigs which she sells once they have grown, work she has been doing for the past 8 years. The added value that she creates has allowed her to get ahead, along with the help of her oldest son who is her right hand in this business. She also has a small eatery in the city that she runs with her 23 year old son. 

With this loan Yolanda will buy more pigs, since the market for pork continues to grow as it is consumed in a number of different dishes. 

Yolanda wants to have a very strong business in her region, in order to be more competitive in the market and obtain more income through her sales.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander lives in Vinogradovo with his wife and 8-year-old son. He works in agriculture, growing and selling vegetables. Mostly he sells potatoes, carrots, beets, onions, and also apples. Alexander rents a vending spot to sell his produce. Moreover, Alexander also grows cabbage and potatoes on his own big lot of land. Usually Alexander works on his land himself. He only hires employees during sowing and harvesting seasons. 
Alexander is planning a trip to another region of Volyn to purchase potatoes and carrots at wholesale for further retail sale in his hometown. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to pursue that.  One of Alexander’s biggest dreams is to open a vegetable store.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and carrots at wholesale for further retail sale in his hometown.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Adama from Waterloo2, in East End of Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  In 2010, Adama established her local food business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and a poor network of roads.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari, a food made from cassava, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Isatu from Waterloo, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2011, Isatu established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her family. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of  capital.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more to local staples and clothing to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future; Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more to local staples and clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Alice from Waterloo, Western rural area, in Freetown. She is married with two children. 

In 2007, Alice established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that moving door to door to sell her clothing material is very difficult.

Alice requires a loan in order to buy a variety of clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Alice plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Olga Cecilia

texts.es: Olga es una mujer campesina de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de 10 y 11 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a cultivar papas bajo un sistema de colonización de cultivos, actividad que realiza en un lote prestado y que aprendió por tradición familiar; la cosecha que recolecta es vendida en el mercado de la región donde reside y, de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Ella manifiesta que con empeño y mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sobrepasar las dificultades que se le presentan, especialmente con los costos elevados de los insumos agrícolas que requiere y la disminución en el precio de venta del producto, lo que ha ocasionado crisis económica en el hogar; sin embargo, esto no la detiene para seguir adelante con su labor, pues su principal objetivo es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes la motivan cada día para no desfallecer. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas, entre otros), así podrá continuar cuidando sus cultivos y podrá tener una cosecha mucho más productiva, que le permita vender a mejor precio el producto y así aumentar el margen de utilidades, con lo que podrá seguir mejorando la economía de su familia y podrá brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos, mejorando no sólo la calidad de vida, sino el bienestar de todos los que ama.
texts.en:
Olga is a 28 year old woman from the countryside, married with two chidlren who are 10 and 11 years old. Two years ago she begain cultivating potatoes on a rented lot under a community harvest system. She learned how to grow potatoes from her family. She sells her harvests in her town's local market, and by doing so earns enough income to support her husband with their home expenses. Olga tells us that with a lot of hard work and effort she has been able to overcome many difficulties that have arisen, especially the high costs of agricultutral ingredients and diminished prices at which she can sell her goods (which have caused the family some problems). Nevertheless, these difficulties have not stopped her from continuing her work, as her main goal is to get ahead so her children can have a better life. They are her motivation. 

Currently, Olga is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale agricultural ingredients (fertilizer, pesticide, and fungicide among others), which she will use to continue to care for her crops. With a more productive field, she will be able to sell better products at a higher price, thereby increasing her margins. She will be able to provide a better education for her children, improving not only her own quality of life but the wellbeing of those that she loves.

loans.use: to buy farming ingredients such as fertilizer, pesticide and fungicide

loans.name: Tersinha

texts.en: A loan of $600.00 is offered to Teresinha to improve her business. She is a widow and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as cigarettes, oils, salt, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, and rice. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Tersinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en: Arminda is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. She is running a business in front of her house by selling custom clothes. She makes a good income from selling and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She ran her business a year ago with her own working capital of $200.

loans.use: To buy custom clothes to sell

loans.name: Dalita

texts.en:
Dalita is 29 years old. She is married, and she has four children. Only three of the children are in school now.

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 US, which she will use to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000, with her own working capital of $100 US. She earns a good income from her business. She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as petrol and diesel.

She is a very hard-working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions, in the future.

loans.use: To buy petrol and diesel to sell

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is 37-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a poultry farm beside the home; he has many hens for getting eggs to sell. He supplies the eggs to the bakery, general stores and wholesalers. His business is going very well and he is getting enough profit for his family. 

Due to coming winter weather the demand for eggs increases as well. To cope with the demand and for getting maximum profit; he wants to buy more hens for getting more eggs to sell. But due to household expenses, utility bills and miscellaneous expenses he is unable to buy more hens. 

Therefore, Ghulam requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so that he could buy more hens and could get maximum profit in winter season. 

Ghulam is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy hens for getting more eggs.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang is 34 years old.  She is married and has four children who live under her income and care. Sang and her husband temporarily live in a rental room in Phnom Penh because of jobs. Sang is a garment worker, who can earn a normal salary of USD 70 per month, while her husband works in the construction industry, making a daily wage of KHR 27,000 per day. This couple is experiencing difficulties in their transportation needs because they don’t have their own motorcycle.  For this reason, they have to pay for taxi service every day. Sang wants to minimize some expenses and save more for the family, so she is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their needs. With this purchase, Sang and her husband can commute to work by themselves and without paying for taxi service. She thanks lenders for their generosity towards poor people like her.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to fulfill their needs.

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.es:
La señora Altagracia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de Tortillas y Ropa, desde hace 15 años. 
Doña Altagracia tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos que ella recorre ofreciendo su producto. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos maíz, leña y cal para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le ayuda mucho ya que las ganancias son de mucha utilidad en el hogar.
Doña Altagracia con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten de forma y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario, y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Altagracia espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Altagracia is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. Her business is selling tortillas and clothing which she has done for 15 years. 
Altagracia has her business in her home in the town where she lives. She walks to nearby places to offer her products. She needs the loan to buy more corn, firewood, and lime to continue doing her job, which helps a lot since profits are very useful in her home.
With this loan, Altagracia expects to increase sales. The loan would be very useful to this end because she does not always have the necessary products to cover the orders made by her clients on a daily basis. Thanks to this loan she hopes to improve the quality of life for her family with the increased household income. 
Doña Altagracia expects to grow her business in the short term and to continue to support her family and her children achieve the education necessary for more opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es:
La señora Doris es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de  cerdos y granos básicos, desde hace 8 años.
Doña Doris tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y también sale a vender lugares aledaños  en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más cerdos, maíz, frijoles y azúcar productos que necesita para seguir realizando su negocio, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Doris con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Doris su sueño es que en un corto plazo su negocio crezca y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y a sus hijos con  los estudios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Doris is a very hardworking, humble, and responsible person who lives in a community south of Honduras with her family. She has been selling pigs and staple grains for 8 years.

Doris has her business in her home and goes out to the surrounding areas to sell in the town where she lives.  She needs a loan to buy more pigs, corn, beans, and sugar products so that she can continue carrying out her business which provides a large part of her income.

Doris expects sales to increase with the loan and that this will be of much use since she doesn't have the products that her customers want to cover their requested orders. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve the quality of life of her family with her increasing household income.

Doris's dream is that in a short while her business will grow and with this she can continue supporting her family and her children's education.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to purchase pigs, corn, beans, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Lokossou Claire's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Lokossou Claire (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Lokossou Claire est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Clément. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lokossou Claire vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménages sont supportées par Lokossou Claire et son mari. C'est pour cette raison que dame Lokossou Claire vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et du charbon de bois à son domicile depuis quatorze ans. Lokossou Claire s'approvisionne chez les grossistes de sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Lokossou Claire s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Lokossou Claire (pictured with her hand raised) who is 38 years old. Lokossou Claire is married to a reseller named Clément. Together they have three children, all of whom attend school and whom they support. Lokossou Claire lives with her husband and children, and together she and her husband take care of the household expenses.

It is for this reason that she has been selling phone recharge cards and charcoal from her home for fourteen years. She stocks up with wholesalers in her region. In order to expand her business, Lokossou Claire joined with the other members of her group to request this first group loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase phone recharge cards and charcoal

loans.name: Zinhoué's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Zinhoué (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans. Zinhoué est mariée à un certain Hospice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Zinhoué vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Zinhoué vend des chaussures et de la bouillie par la méthode distribution depuis dix ans. Zinhoué  s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Zinhoué s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Zinhoué (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 39 years old. She is married to a man named Hospice, and together they have two children, both of whom attend school and are in their care. Besides their children, the couple has an additional child that they support.

Zinhoué lives with her husband and children, and together the couple provides for the household expenses. In order to accomplish this, Zinhoué has been selling shoes and porridge as a distributor for ten years. She stocks up at a market in Benin and in Togo. In order to expand her business, Zinhoué is joining the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is applying for a loan of $1,000 US, which she will use to improve her business. She is running a business at her house, selling petrol, diesel and kerosene. She is making a good income from this activity, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her working capital of $600.

loans.use: To buy petrol, diesel and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en: Nazima is a 41 year-old married woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, one son and two daughters. She is a hardworking and independent housewife. Her husband is a government employee and his monthly salary is not enough to meet the household expenses. To help her husband, Nazima wants to open a shoe shop. As she has run short of funds, she requested a loan of 20,000PKR from KIVA partner, BRAK.  With this loan, she will open a shoe shop in the market and provide a good future for her daughters.She is happy and thankful to KIVA and BRAC.

loans.use: To buy a variety of new shoes.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Huacho con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Maria se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Informática.
Por iniciativa propia, Maria trabaja como operaria de limpieza en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda comprará una cama y un colchón ortopédico, los cuales le servirán de mucho para calmar sus dolencias en la espalda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and lives in the city of Huacho with her parents and siblings. She is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and puts a lot of effort into getting ahead in life. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her parents, Maria is studying a professional career in IT systems. In addition, through her own initiative, Maria works as a cleaning lady for a local business, where she spends about 10 hours a day. She believes that her work is going well because of her dedication and effort. 

Maria is very grateful for Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help she hopes to be able to buy a bed and an orthopedic mattress. Both of these will help her a lot since she suffers from back pains. Maria will continue working hard to achieve her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy a bed and orthopedic mattress

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Martha tiene 35 años de edad la cual es una mujer que se dedica a la producción de café ella es madre de 5 hijos los cuales 2 trabajan en los cultivos de café junto a su padre mientras ella asiste a los demás en casa que son menores. En compañía de su esposo se dirigen diariamente a los cultivos de café en donde ellos se encargan de dar el mantenimiento necesario como: poda, limpia, levantamiento de sombra, fertilización aplicación de abono ya que de esa manera ellos protegen sus cultivos de maleza, bichos, plagas etc. sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 30 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando. Con un grado de educación primaria incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el 5 grado ella agradece a sus padres por haberle brindado la oportunidad de aprender lo básico en las aulas de un centro el cual en su juventud muchos amigos y vecinos no tuvieron la oportunidad de hacerlo. 
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con hogares establecidos y sólidos. También sueña con poder ver algún día sus cultivos de café comprando más tierra y sembrando una variedad de café atractiva para sus clientes y con un buen precio en el mercado ya que de esa forma ella generara ingresos para su familia y fortalecerá la economía en su hogar. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 6 unidades de abono 12-24-12 y 3 unidades de urea para asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old and works growing coffee. She has five children, two of whom work in the coffee plantation alongside their father while she takes care of the younger ones at home. Along with her husband they head out to the coffee plantations where they take care of all the necessary maintenance: pruning, cleaning, putting up shade, and fertilizing in order to protect the plants from weeds, bugs, pests, etc. The coffee plants are located thirty minutes away from home and they get there walking. 

She was able to stay in school until the fifth grade, so she never finished primary school, but she is grateful to her parents for having given her the opportunity of learning the basics in the classrooms of a center that many of her childhood friends and neighbors were not able to attend. 

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals and make a solid and stable home for themselves. She also hopes to improve her business by purchasing more land and growing coffee varieties that will attract more customers and sell at a good price on the market, because that will allow her to generate income for her family and strengthen the household economy. That is why she is now requesting a loan, which she will use to buy six units of 12-24-12 fertilizer and three units of urea to help her grow coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and urea for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Enma Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Enma es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es de Destace y venta de carne, desde hace 5 años.
Doña Enma tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más cerdos para seguir con la producción de su negocio y de esta manera seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Enma con el préstamo espera comprar más productos para que su producción y sus ventas aumenten y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes  y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Enma en un corto plazo espera hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en cualquier problema económico que se presente, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Enma is a hard-working and responsible woman who lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. Her business is the butchering and sale of meat which she has done for five years. 
Doña Enma has her business in the house where she lives in her hometown. She needs a loan to buy more pigs to continue with her business's production and, thus, to continue her work. 
With this loan, Doña Enma expects to purchase more products so that her production and sales will grow and therefore satisfy the demands of her clients. Thanks to their demand, she hopes to improve the quality of life for her family with a rising household income.
Doña Enma hopes to grow her business in the short term and to continue to support her family during any economic problem that arises so they can have more opportunities in life.



Choluteca, Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her business.

loans.name: Iris Milady

texts.es:
La joven Iris  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 10 años.
Iris tiene  su pulpería en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, frijoles, maíz, queso, leche, pan, churros, galletas, refrescos. etc. para tener productos para la venta y poder seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Iris espera que esta inversión le genere los ingresos necesarios y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Uno de sus sueños es que en un corto plazo pueda hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia e hija.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
Young Iris is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras.  She's owned a grocery store for 10 years.

Iris has her business in her home in the municipality where she lives.  She needs a loan to buy sugar, beans, corn, cheese, milk, bread, chips, cookies, beverages, etc., so that she can have these items on hand to sell.  This way she can continue to operate her business, which provides a major part of her income.

Iris hopes that this investment will generate the income that she needs so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.  In the short run, one of her dreams is to be able to make her business grow so that she can continue to support her family and her daughter.  



Choluteca, Honduras – October  2013

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, corn, cheese, milk, bread, chips, cookies, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Mawule Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWULE est composé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Houevo Appoline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Houevo Appoline n'a pas  fréquenté l'école. Houevo Appoline est veuve avec deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Houevo Appoline vit seule avec ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Houevo Appoline. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, dame Houevo Appoline vend des casses croûte (fait à base de farine de blé et du sucre) de façon ambulante et à son domicile depuis quinze ans. Houevo Appoline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Houevo Appoline s’associe aux autres membres du groupe MAWULE pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Mawule group is composed of six individuals living n the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Houevo Appoline (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 53 years old. Houevo Appoline never attended school. She is a widow and has two dependent children, one of whom is in school. In order to provide for her children, Houevo Appoline has been selling snacks (made of wheat flour and sugar) as a street vendor and out of her home for 15 years. Houevo Appoline stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business, Houevo Appoline, together with the other members of the Mawule group, is seeking her second loan from ALIDé. Their prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheat floor and sugar.

loans.name: Affognondé's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Affognondé (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 51 ans. Affognondé est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Affognondé vit avec ses enfants. Les charges de ménages sont supportées par Affognondé et son mari. Pour ce faire, Affognondé vend de l'akassa (pâte à base de maïs fermenté), du gari (farine de manioc), des galettes fait à base d'arachide et du sodabi (boisson locale faite à base de vin de palme) à son domicile depuis dix ans. Affognondé s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Affognondé s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Affognondé (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 51 years old. She is married to a man named Didier and together the couple has five children, all of whom attend school and two of whom they support.

Affognondé lives with her children and she and her husband together provide for the household expenses. In order to do this, she has sold "akassa" (a paste made of fermented corn), "gari" (cassava flour), cakes made from peanut paste, and "sodabi" (a local beverage made from palm wine) from her home for ten years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Affognondé is partnering with the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cassava flour, cakes and local beverages

loans.name: Rachidatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Rachidatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Rachidatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture. Rachidatou est mariée à un certain Nawal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Rachidatou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménages sont supportées par Rachidatou et son mari. Pour ce faire Rachidatou vend des articles de mercerie depuis vingt ans dans sa boutique. De façon secondaire, Rachidatou exerce comme activité la couture. Rachidatou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Rachidatou s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Rachidatou (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 42 years old. Rachidatou did not attend school but learned to sew. She is married to a man named Nawal and together they have four children, all of whom attend school and are in their care.

Rachidatou lives with her husband and children, and together the couple provides for the household expenses. In order to accomplish this, Rachidatou has sold dressmaking supplies for twenty years from her shop. As a side business, she also performs sewing services. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Rachidatou is partnering with the other members of her group for their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Âgée de 34ans, Ablavi vit avec ses enfants à Lomé. Afin d'assurer une bonne éducation à ses derniers, elle revend des pagnes et des produits d'alimentation générale dans une boutique. C'est en 2008 qu'elle a démarré et elle sollicite son second prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. le profit l'aidera à mieux assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Ablavi is 34 years old and lives with her children in Lomé. In order to provide a good education for her children, she resells "pagne" cloth (the traditional colorful cloth of western Africa) and food products in a shop. She began the business in 2008 and she is requesting her second loan to be able to purchase more merchandise. The profit she earns will help her provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pagne cloth

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Koami est un homme de 40ans. Il a pour femme une revendeuse et père d'un enfant de 09ans scolarisé. Elle est électricien auto et emploie 10 personnes dans son atelier. Afin d'acheter des pièces auto, il sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES. il espère investir dans l'activité et assurer l'avenir de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 9ans.
texts.en: Koami is a 40-year-old man. He is married to a shopkeeper and is the father of a 9-year-old child who attends school. Koami is a car electrician and employs 10 people in his shop. In order to purchase car parts, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES. He hopes to be able to invest in his business and secure a future for his family. He has been in business for 9 years.

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is taking a loan of $1,000 US, which she will use to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and water. She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of $200. Filomena is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, sugar, salt, and milk

loans.name: Rsheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda is a 37-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past four years he also has driven a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Rasheeda has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the cost of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Rasheeda desires to provide quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business . She is very much thankful to Brac.

loans.use: To pay for repairing taxi

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a very hardworking, honest, and responsible distributor of recharge phone cards. This shop is the only source of income for his family, but the income he makes is not enough to fulfill his family's needs. 

He has a small house, and he intends to buy home improvements. He has requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture to use in his house. He hopes to expand his business to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of four children, two of whom go to school and two are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki cooks fried potatoes and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Ms. Annet is a business lady, married, and has four children. She is a repeat client who graduated from a group setting to individual borrowing, and applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX. She runs a retail business that sells food stuff. Her business is located in Ntinda, in the outskirt of Kampala City. She has actually been running this business since 1995. The purpose of the loan is to pay tuition for two of her children. Annet is not only an honest and a very hard working person, but also a financially disciplined person.
 
Her dream has always been to open up a wholesale business to expand her income base. Her challenge is that she normally finds it difficult to pay school fees and at the same time, maintain a capital in the business. She thanks Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to pay tuition for two of her children.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, en la comunidad de Oyotún, en una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores y cultivos de maíz, yuca, café.

Son una familia emprendedora, hace 8 años se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, José ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños patos, gallinas y cuyes para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, así como también la compra de alimentos balanceados generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in the community of Oyotún, in a rural area where residents work selling small animals and growing corn, cassava, and coffee.

They are an enterprising family and have been raising and selling animals for eight years. Their business is located at home and José has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles in order to purchase small animals - ducks, hens, and Guinea pigs - which he will fatten up and sell at a better price. He will also buy balanced feed. This will help him generate higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy ducks, hens, Guinea pigs, and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra is from the village of Cheung Prey, Kampong Cham. She is dedicated to farming activities, primarily planting and harvesting rice, on less than one hectare of farmland. The income she makes from the farming business is barely enough to cover the family’s living costs, so Ra and her husband also sell chopped wood from a horse-pulled trailer, to earn additional income.

To help improve her business, Ra has applied for a loan in the sum of KHR 1,500,000. She plans to buy a horse for the chopped wood business. She is planning to buy a stock of chopped wood to sell, and thereby increase her sales. Ra hopes that this work will bring her earnings and will bring prosperity to her family.

loans.use: to buy a horse, for hauling the trailer full of chopped wood

loans.name: Djidide Dehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDIDE DEHOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Béatrice (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 40 ans. Béatrice n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Béatrice est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Saliou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Béatrice et son mari. Pour ce faire, Béatrice vend divers produits (boîtes de conserves, savons, sardines, et huile d'arachide) à son domicile depuis dix ans. Béatrice s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Béatrice s’associe aux autres membres du groupe DJIDIDE DEHOU pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Djidide Dehou group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Béatrice (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 40 years old. Béatrice did not attend school. She is married to a mechanic named Saliou, and together they have three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support. In addition to their own children, the couple also supports an additional child.

Béatrice and her husband provide for the household expenses. In order to do this, Béatrice has sold various products (canned goods, soaps, sardines, and peanut oil) from her home for ten years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Béatrice is partnering with the other members of the Djidide Dehou group to request their third loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase various items (canned goods, soaps, sardines, and peanut oil.)

loans.name: Nonvignon C2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON C2 est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Sènami Gisèle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Sènami Gisèle est mariée à un certain Jean-Charles. Le couple n'a pas enfant, mais a un enfant scolarisé à leur charge. Sènami Gisèle vit avec son mari. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Sènami Gisèle vend divers produits ( du lait, des boites de conserves, du papier hygiénique, et du savon) à son domicile depuis dix ans. Sènami Gisèle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Sènami Gisèle s’associe aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON C2 pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Nonvignon C2 group is made up of two people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Sènami Gisèle (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 42 years old. She is married to a man named Jean-Charles. They don't have any children, but do support a child in their care who attends school. Sènami Gisèle lives with her husband and together they provide for the household expenses.

It is for this reason that Sènami Gisèle has been selling various products (milk, canned goods, toilet paper, and soap) from her home for ten years. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Sènami Gisèle has partnered with the other members of Nonvignon C2 to request a third loan from ALIDé. Their previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase various products (milk, canned goods, toilet paper, and soap.)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes used the previous loan to buy used shoes to sell. She is a hardworking, young woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used to sell for someone else but then started her own business using the savings she made while working. The challenges she faces include price fluctuation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to buy more stock. Her personal goal is to build a permanent home while her business goals are to move her business to a more permanent location and to expand into new markets. Agnes intends to use the loan facility to buy more shoes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Cesar Renan

texts.es:
Cesar Renan tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su menor hijo en Yecala, una zona rural del distrtito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio que pertenece a Morropon a dos horas de la Región Piura.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la elaboración y venta de adobe, actividad que consiste en mesclar la tierra, agua y pajilla de arroz para luego colocarlo en moldes para su posterior secado, sirviendo como material de construcción de paredes de una casa, José ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en arreglos de su casa, comprar calamina y puertas y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro donde residir con su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Renan is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and their young child in Yecala, a rural area in La Matanza district, whose residents work in agriculture and trade. It belongs to Morropon, two hours from Piura region.

Alongside his family, he works making and selling adobe. This business entails mixing clay, water, and rice straw, and pouring it into molds to dry. The resulting bricks can then be used as construction material to build walls for a house.

José has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in repairing his house. He will buy corrugated sheet metal and doors so that he can have a safe place to live with his family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheet metal and doors.

loans.name: Zekeria

texts.fr: Père d'un enfant de 16ans scolarisé mr Zékéria est revendeur de batteries pour voiture dans la zone portuaire. Démarré en 2010, il s'approvisionne au même lieu et revend à ses clients. Il voudrait à l'avenir, étendre son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il est âgé de 35ans.
texts.en: Zékéria is a father of a 16-year-old child who attends school. He is a reseller of car batteries in the port area. He began his business in 2010, and acquires his merchandise in the same area and resells them to his customers. In the future, he would like to expand his business and provide for the needs of his family. He is 35 years old.

loans.use: to purchase batteries

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 50 years old, and a hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two daughters. Both of her daughters are studying in third class. Her husband is a security guard, and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For 15 years, Asiya has been running a beauty salon. She wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Asiya requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan.

On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva. Then, she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon now is too much congested. She hopes that her business will grow more, and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en: Sadam is a 23-year-old,who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man.  He is an employee in the Ministry of the Interior. He has a small house. He said his salary is not enough to buy what he needs. So he is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER to cover the costs of purchasing furniture for his house. This will ensure him better living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing furniture for his house.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en: Otilia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock like gasoline to keep in her store.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn is 24 years old, married and has four dependent children. She raises her children in a rural community where she lives and operates her agribusiness. 

Choeurn is a farmer who has engaged in the rice cultivation and hog-raising businesses for several years. She aims to improve the business by adding five pigs, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of KHR 700,000 as added capital for the purchase of five pigs to raise. She will reinvest the profits to further develop her business. She thanks lenders for their generosity towards a poor farmer like her.

loans.use: to buy five pigs to raise.

loans.name: Mary Altagracia

texts.es:
Doña  Mary es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su familia en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas,  el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto es mucha.
Doña Mary necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para  seguir elaborando sus tortillas  de  esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar.
Doña Mary espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
Doña Mary su sueño es que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre   2013
texts.en:
Mary is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. Her business is making and selling tortillas, and it is very well-known in her community, so there is a high demand for her products.

Mary needs this loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime, in order to continue making her tortillas. This will allow her to keep up this source of income, which is very important to her household.

Mary expects this loan to allow her to have the ingredients and supplies she needs in order to keep her business going and meet her customers' demand. She also expects sales to increase, which will result in a better quality of life for her family.

Mary's dream is for her business to keep growing and become the most recognized in her community, so that she can continue to support her family and they can have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Mahoulé Agnès' Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Mahoulé Agnès (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Mahoulé Agnès est mariée à un certain du Dieudonné. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mahoulé Agnès vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de ménage. C'est pour cette raison que Mahoulé Agnès vend divers produits ( lait concentré, sardine, savon, papier hygiénique, huile de palme) et du tchoukoutou (boisson locale fait à base de maïs) à son domicile depuis vingt cinq ans. Mahoulé Agnès s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Mahoulé Agnès s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Mahoulé Agnès (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 37 years old. Mahoulé Agnès is married to a man named Dieudonné, and together they have three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support. Mahoulé Agnès lives with her husband and children, and together the couple provides for the household expenses.

It is for this reason that Mahoulé Agnès has sold various products (concentrated milk, sardines, soap, toilet paper, palm oil) and "tchoukoutou" (a local beverage made from corn) from her home for twenty-five years. She stocks up in a market in Benin. In order to expand her business, Mahoulé Agnès has partnered with the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated milk, sardines, soap, toilet paper, and palm oil.

loans.name: Sahaa

texts.en:
Sahaa was born in 1963. She is married and lives with her husband and 8 children in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband is a retired man who currently works in agriculture. 

Sahaa has been selling home products for 1 year. She started her project with selling a small quantity of them and she found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of home products to earn a better income that will help her support her family financially but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: María Dulfay

texts.es: María, a sus 52 años de edad, es una mujer casada y madre de 1 hijo. Desde que era muy joven comenzó a generar ingresos por cuenta propia, vendiendo mercancía a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos y, de esta manera fue adquiriendo experiencia en esta actividad y generando recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Su empuje, esmero y pasión por lo que hace, le han permitido salir adelante y poco a poco ha logrado aumentar su clientela; por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía, especialmente traída de Estados Unidos y Panamá, ya que desea iniciar su propio almacén en su casa y; en estos países puede adquirir las prendas y los diversos artículos a menor costo como blusas, camisetas, tennis, bolsos, perfumería, entre otros, lo que le permitirá aumentar el margen de ganancia por cada venta que realice, además tendrá la oportunidad de atender mejor a sus clientes, especialmente en la temporada de navidad en la que las personas buscan todo tipo de artículos para hacer obsequios. María dice que seguirá trabajando con dedicación y esmero para seguir aumentando su capital y así poder continuar aportando a la economía de su familia, con la que han podido sacar adelante a su hijo y brindarle un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Maria is 52, married, and mother of one child. Ever since she was very young, she has worked at making money on her own account, by selling goods to family, neighbours and friends. In this way she has gained experience in this activity and generated income to support her husband with the household expenses.

Her drive, carefulness and passion for what she does have allowed her to make progress and, little by little, she has managed to increase her clientele. For this reason she is keen to request the loan in order to invest it into buying goods, specially brought in from the US and Panama, as she wants to start her own store in her home. She can procure garments and various goods at the lowest cost from these countries, such as blouses, shirts, tennis shoes, bags and perfume. This permits her to increase her profit margin on each sale, and also she has the opportunity of providing a better service to her customers, especially at Christmas, when people look for all sorts of things as presents. 

Maria says that she will continue working with dedication and care to carry on growing her capital and thus to be able to go on contributing to the family economy. In this way they have been able to provide a good education for their son and offer him a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods in the US and Panama, such as blouses, shirts, tennis shoes, bags and perfume.

loans.name: Gian Carlos

texts.es:
Gian es un hombre de 35 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es muy trabajador,entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; actualmente Gian trabaja en una empresa de cobranzas de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Gian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar una cocina y artículos para el hogar, ya que de esta manera preparará mejor sus alimentos, así pues Gian seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gian, 35, is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is hard-working and enthusiastic, committed to getting ahead in the world.  He works for a local collection agency, working every day, for 10 hours a day.  He will do well, he says, because he works hard and is dedicated to his job.
