He thanks lenders for contributing their own money in a program like Kiva via its partner, HKL, to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and increase their personal hygiene. For this kind of loan product, HKL has provided him with a special interest rate different from its general products.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline lives in the Kongowea area north of Mombasa. She is 29 years old and married with two children. Both her children attend school. She owns a small retail business that deals with cosmetics and women's handbags. She has been in the business for the last two years. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy handbags and mobile bags for her business. She hopes that her business will graduate into a wholesale business in the next five years. The challenge in the business is the seasons when sales are really low. The extra income that she will raise from the business will improve her standard of living and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy handbags and mobile bags

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, maíz, algodón y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican desde hace 10 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, gallinas, cuyes, ovejas, Miguel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in Oyotun district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's North Coast. The people here grow sugar cane, corn, cotton and raise small animals.

Miguel together with his family have spent the last ten years raising and selling small animals, ducks, chickens, guinea pigs and sheep. Miguel has requested a loan of 1200 PEN to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals. In this way he can offer a better price to his clients, generating greater revenue for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene, 25, is single. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Rita Gloriosa

texts.es:
La señora Rita es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una venta de refrescos y churros, desde hace 15 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña Rita necesita el préstamo para la compra de refrescos, churros, galletas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos, con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes.
Doña Rita espera que su calidad de vida mejore con la inversión y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia a que mejoren su situación económica para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Rita's a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras.  Her business for 15 years has been selling soft drinks and chips.  She runs it in her house in the town where she lives.

Rita needs the loan to buy soft drinks, chips, cookies, etc., to continue doing her job, which gives her a big part of her income.  She hopes the loan will increase her sales and help her a lot because she doesn't have the products she needs to fill her customers' orders.

Rita hopes her quality of life will improve with the investment.  She wants her business to grow in the short term so she can keep on supporting her family, improve her economic situation, and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, October 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, and cookies

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 35 years old. She owns a detergent business that has been operating for the last five months. She also sells second hand clothes to earn extra income. She has an ambition of opening a retail shop in the future. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy soap-making powder. The challenges that she faces in the business include high fuel and transportation costs. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soap-making powder.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta, de 47 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Todos los días junto a su esposo, salen a cuidar sus sembríos de maíz y papa en sus terrenos propios, los que cuida con mucho esmero por que le gusta la agricultura, además construyó en su casa un vivero, donde siembra diversas hortalizas y vegetales, esto le sirve a ella para su propio consumo, “así no gasto mucho en los alimentos de mis hijos, además son de calidad pues son orgánicos”, comenta. En época de cosecha, comercializa sus productos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde ella misma lleva a vender sus alimentos, ya que es conocedora del lugar y los negociantes. Ahora posee 2 vacas que piensa alimentar y engordar para poder extraer leche y así realizar queso, espera concretar su nuevo proyecto, pues quiere comercializarlos en la ciudad, aprovechando los viajes que realiza para comercializar sus propias cosechas. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Modesta, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Modesta at 47 years old is a simple woman. She lives in company with her children who she cares for in the house that she bought a few years ago. Every day along with her husband she goes out to care for their corn and potato crops grown on their own land. 

She enjoys agriculture and gives special care to her plants. She has also built a greenhouse at her house where she plants a variety of vegetables and produce. These are used for their own consumption. "thus we don't spend a loft on feeding our children, plus as they are organic they are of high quality". At harvest time she sells her product in the city of Huancayo. She takes the product there herself so she is knowledgeable about the city and business.

She now has two cows which she is thinking of feeding and fattening in order to produce milk which she would use to make cheese. She hopes to  carry out this new project as she would sell the cheese in the city, taking advantage of the trips she makes selling her harvests. 

This is Modesta`s first loan with Kiva and she is pleased as she has the money she needs to improve her business and in the end her quality of life. Modesta will invest the loan buying organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Shoroq

texts.en:
Shoroq is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her brother appears in the photo

Shoroq is a 20-year-old single young lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small and simple house. Shoroq's father is a worker in the construction field where he gets a good income but not a stable one due to the market demand. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Shoroq is a student in her third year at a local university. She studies pharmaceuticals. She would like to finish her studies and find a job in the future. 

Shoroq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. This will help her in writing her reports and homework.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
Dania is a 17-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a small and simple house. Dania's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Dania is a student in her first year at a local university. She studies Information Technology. She would like to finish her studies and find a job in the future.
 
Dania took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. This will help her in writing her reports and homework. 

Dania appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Cornel

texts.en: Cornel lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 38 years old and a carpenter by training. He has done carpentry for the last three years and the business has been growing ever since he started it. He has ambitions to own a showroom that will showcase his work. He learned of Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy timber for the business. The major challenge in the business is the cost of transportation that has been cutting his income. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 19-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Hussien's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Hussien is a student in his first year at a local university. He studies Physical Education. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Hussien took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. 

Hussien appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Saji

texts.en:
Saji is a 17-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Saji's father is a plumber. It is a good business but not stable. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Saji is a student in his first year at a local university. He studies Business Administration. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Saji took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. 

Saji appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 17-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Moath's father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Moath is a student in his first year at a local university. He studies commerce. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Moath took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. 

Moath appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 18-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Mohammad's father is a paint worker. It is a good job but the income is not stable. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad is a student in his first year in a local university. He studies Educational Science. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Nadi

texts.en:
Nadi is a 22-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Nadi's brother works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Nadi is a student in his last year in a local university. He studies business administration. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future. 

Nadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. Nadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Adriana Milena

texts.es: Adriana, con 38 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 3 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el área comercial y, desde hace 10 años pudo adquirir una tienda de abarrotes ubicada la frente de la casa donde reside, allí trabaja solo todos los días, gracias a la experiencia que tiene en el manejo de este tipo de establecimientos, ya que algunos de sus familiares se dedican a esta actividad; ofrece todo tipo de productos para la canasta familiar y, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Sus principales desafíos son la competencia que hay en el sector y lograr mantener a su familia con los ingresos que obtiene; sin embargo, la cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, activa y trabajadora y, siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas, mecato, entre otros), lo que le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos disponible para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, permitiéndole tener más ventas y mejorar los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Adriana sueña con formalizar su negocio, acreditarlo y, en un futuro poder comprar un local para no tener que seguir pagando arriendo, pues es muy costoso y afecta las finanzas familiares; haciendo esto podrá brindar un mejor bienestar y educación a sus hijos y tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecerles una estabilidad económica y calidad de vida favorable.
texts.en:
Adriana, 38, is a single mother with three children.  Throughout her working life she has earned a living in the field of commerce.

Ten years ago Adriana was able to acquire a grocery store located in the front of the house where she lives.  She works there alone every day, thanks to her experience running this type of business, because some of her relatives earn a living in this line of work.  She sells all the staple products that families need, generating the income to pay for her basic household necessities.

Adriana's main challenges are the competition in the field and managing to support her family with her income.  Nevertheless, she's known for being strong, active, and hardworking.

Adriana's always looking for new alternatives so she can continue making progress.  This is why she's requesting the support of the loan to buy stock wholesale (soda, beer, snack food, and other things).  This will allow her to have available products to satisfy demand, which increases with the coming Christmas season.  She'll have better sales and improve her income.

Adriana dreams of positioning her business and buying a store in the future so she doesn't have to keep paying rent, which is very costly and affects the family finances.  Doing this, she'll be able to give her children greater well-being and a better education as well as economic stability and a favorable quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. 

Asma is a 19-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives with her husband in a simple small house. Asma's husband works as an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Asma's brother owns a small office for general services especially for students. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Asma took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her brother to buy a new computer for his service office. This will increase the family income and also improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new computer for her brother's service office

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 27-year-old married man from a small village near Bethlehem city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a simple house in the city. For the past thirty years, Amir's family has been working in a carpentry workshop they own. Amir gained his experience when he was very young. Amir would like to improve his workshop and meet all the demands in the market.

Amir took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials for his carpentry shop. This will improve his productivity and also his income. Amir appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for his carpentery shop

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is aged 32. She has four children and has been in the business of farming for the past years. She would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  joven  Maritza  una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable  y seria, vive con  su  hija en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  venta  de  plásticos  y  refrescos  lo cual  hace desde hace más de 5 años en su comunidad.
Martiza el préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de toda clase de plásticos vasos, viandas, baldes, pailas y refrescos. Con la inversión que realice a su negocio espera que las ventas aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Maritza espera que  a un corto plazo   su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en  el  más conocido de su comunidad y seguir  apoyando a su familia a su hija.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre  del   2013
texts.en:
Maritza is an enterprising, honest, responsible, and serious young person.  She lives with her daughter in a community in the south of Honduras.  Her business is selling plastic items and soft drinks, which she has done in her community for more than five years.

Maritza needs the loan to buy all types of plastic items, glasses, food, buckets, dishes, and soft drinks.  She hopes making the investment will increase her sales because she'll have more merchandise to sell to her customers to fulfill their needs.

Maritza hopes her business will keep on growing and becoming established in the short term so she'll be the best known business in her community and she can continue supporting her family and her daughter.

Choluteca, Honduras, October 2013

loans.use: to buy plastic items and food

loans.name: Mouniratou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Mouniratou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Mouniratou a très peu fréquenté l'école. Mouniratou est mariée à un certain Raoul. Le couple a deux enfants, tous à leur charge et aucun scolarisés. Mouniratou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Mouniratou exerce comme activité la restauration. Activité qu'elle exerce dans sa région depuis deux ans. Mouniratou désire acquérir un réfrigérateur, dans l'optique de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Mouniratou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Mouniratou s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Mouniratou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 29 years old. Mouniratou has very little formal education. Mouniratou is married to Raoul. The couple has two dependent children - neither of whom goes to school. Mouniratou lives with her husband and children. The household expenses are taken care of by the couple. 

In order to do this, Mouniratou has been in the restaurant business for two years. Mouniratou would like to buy a refrigerator to better satisfy her clientele. Mouniratou buys her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Mouniratou is working with the other members of her group to ask for a third loan with ALIDé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sickali

texts.en:
Sickali lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a 35-year-old, widowed business-lady with two children. Sickali sells charcoal at the market centre, and has been in business for two years. She has ambitions of growing her business and becoming a supplier in the next five years. 

She heard of Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy 10 sacks of charcoal for her business. The major challenges in this business are weather and transportation costs. She hopes to use the income that she will raise to educate her children and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawlah is a 38-year-old married woman from Jenin city. She is a mother of two boys and six daughters: all of them are under 18 years old. Khawlah's husband is an electric worker. He earns a good income but it is not stable. Khawlah works in a sewing workshop to help her husband with part of the family expenses. Khawlah has been working in this field for eight years and she has very good experience.
 
Khawlah took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine because the one she has is very old. This will improve the quality of her work and also her income will increase.

Khawlah appears in the photo in her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine because the one she has is very old

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 54-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of four sons and one daughter. Jihad and her husband have been working in planting seasonal crops and selling them in the market for the past thirty years. It is a good business and earns a good income, but the land needs a lot of development.
 
Jihad took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy fertilizers and a new irrigation system for her land. This will improve the land conditions and also their productivity and sales will increase.

Jihad appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a new irrigation system for her land

loans.name: Omari

texts.en: Omari lives in Mombasa Kenya. He is 30 years of age and married with two children. He runs a water-vending business that has been in operation for the last year and the business has been growing. He wants to buy a water tank that will enable him to serve more people. He also owns a handcart that he hires out when he is not using it. In the next five years he hopes that he will own more than ten handcarts for hiring out. The business faces transportation challenges and he hopes that he will be able to buy a lorry that will help him distribute water. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living and allow him to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Ce membre a adhéré au programme depuis décembre 2009.

Elle est âgée de 30ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.Son activité  est l'élevage de moutons et la vente de maïs.

Elle affirme qu'elle dispose d'une bonne expérience par rapport à l'élevage car l'ayant pratiqué depuis son enfance.

Avec le financement,elle compte acheter 03 brebis pour une valeur de 75000f et 50 sacs de maïs à 5000f le sac.

Son objectif est d'assurer les fournitures scolaires de ses enfants,leurs scolarités et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This member joined the program in December 2009.

She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of four children - two of whom are boys. Her business involves raising sheep and selling corn. 

She has confirms she has good experience with livestock farming as she has been doing this since childhood.

With the loan, she would like to buy three sheep for 75,000F and 50 sacks of corn for 5000F per sack. 

Her goal is to provide school supplies for her children, to ensure their education, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: buy sheep and corn.

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife in a small house in the city. For the past five years, Saed has been working in home gypsum design. It is a good business and has a good demand in the market. Also, Saed has good experience in this field. 

Saed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more gypsum templates for his business. By applying this loan, Saed will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Saed appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more gypsum templates for his business.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Khon is 45 years old and married with an adult child. He is a hardworking farmer who cultivates rice in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Thom province. The income from the business is rarely enough to cover the costs of living, so Khon also raises a few piglets and works as a paid laborer to make additional income.

In order to further develop his business, Khon has applied for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and buy 10 piglets to raise. This loan will be a great help to enable him to make improvements to the current businesses, and thereby boost more income for the family. He will continue with the loan and is hoping that he can secure the overall welfare of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and buy 10 piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Благодаря средствам, полученным Наталией от КИВА предыдущий раз, она смогла расширить свой ассортимент товара, увеличить объемы реализуемой продукции и, следовательно, увеличить свой доход. За счет дополнительных денежных поступлений в бюджет семьи, Наталия смогла позволить себе сделать некоторые обновки в доме, купив необходимую мебель и товары для дома. 
В этот раз Наталия обратилась за суммой в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести шарфики, платки и колготки под реализацию на своей торговой точке в этом сезоне.
texts.en: Thanks to her last loan through Kiva, Natalia was able to expand her stock of goods for sale, increase her liquid assets, and, by doing so, increase her income.  In addition, with the extra money she brought in, she was able to afford some new furniture and appliances for her home.  Hoping to repeat her success from the last loan, Natalia is seeking to borrow an additional 5,000 griven to stock up on scarves, head scarves and pantyhose to sell at her market stall this season.

loans.use: stock up on scarves, head scarves and pantyhose

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en: Zurab is a 32-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Khashuri district with his wife, two sons and parents. Zurab is involved in a husbandry business. He has cows and produces cheese to sell at local markets. In addition, he has rented out room when there are some tourists and gets a small income. As the income is not stable, Zurab decided to request a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to use $3,000 to purchase a minibus. As the minibus is purchased, he will serve people to transport on the minibus line and will be able to increase the income of his family. The Start Up loan will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on a minibus line.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 34-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of  four children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He delivers luggage, grass and water by using a donkey cart. He values the donkey cart more than any other possession because it can make money to sustain his family's life. He needs capital for the maintenance of the donkey cart. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult.

Therefore, his wife, Shazia, requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband. Her husband wants to purchase a vehicle to earn money instead of using a donkey cart. They will invest the profit in savings. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to earn money instead of using a donkey cart.

loans.name: Jules

texts.en:
Jules is 24 years old. He has one child. He has been a farmer for the past seven years. He would like to use Kiva's loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Amour De Dieu

texts.en:
Amour De Dieu is 26 years old. He would like to use Kiva's loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and supportslabor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en:
Patrice is 46 years old. She is married with five children, aged between 12 and 25. She would like to use Kiva's loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Xavera

texts.en:
Xavera is 47 years old. She is married with five children. She would like to use Kiva's loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but has no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past year, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as being her major challenge. With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase spare parts and paint her motorcycle. 

She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint her motorcycle.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene, aged 39, is married with six children. He would like to use Kiva's loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
Galib is a 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and mother in a small village of the Bolnisi District. Galib is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where potatoes and maize are grown. He is a very hardworking man and always has high quality products which are sold to local retailers at a good price. In addition, he sometimes works as an artisan and earns income.

Galib decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase a minibus. As the minibus is purchased, he will trade fruits and vegetables, and he will increase the income of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
Василь – из Берегово. Он работает директором сельской школы. Василь с семьей живет в собственном одноэтажном доме. 
Сумма в 20 000 гривен необходима Василю для того, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия. Он давно надеялся сделать пристройку к своему дому, чтобы расширить его на еще одну комнату – гостиную. Василь хотел бы достроить стены, переместить окна, вставить входные двери и, тем самым, сделать дом уютнее.
texts.en: Vasil is from Beregovo.  He is a principal at a local village school, and lives with his family in their very own 1-story house.  He is seeking a loan of 20,000 griven to renovate his home; for the longest time, he's wanted to add a new living room to his house, and, with this loan, he hopes to be able to do just that, as well as to finish building some walls, move some windows elsewhere, and put in a new set of front doors.  By doing so, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions, and make his house more comfortable to live in.

loans.use: renovate his home

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 51 years old and lives in the village of Dighomi, near the capital city. She has a grown son, daughter-in-law, toddler grandson and retired mother-in-law in her family. Mzia is a masseuse. She has loyal patients and serves them from her house as well as in their places. She is busy all day long and works hard to generate good income for her family's well being. 

In order to generate additional sources of income, Mzia decided to apply for credit and purchase a car. Her son, Guram, who works as a security guard will start working as a taxi driver. He has a work schedule and will be able to work in his free time. Guram will earn daily money, cover the feeding and everyday expenses of the family. Mzia and her son hope the Kiva loan will be helpful for their family.

loans.use: to buy a car for her son's taxi business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 30 years old, and she is a single mother of one. She is a business lady, and she runs a secondhand clothing business. She has been in this business for one year now, and the business has been growing. She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy ten bales of secondhand clothes for her business. She hopes that the business will grow in the next five years and make her an importer. The challenges that she faces in the business include price changes and competition. The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy ten bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is 42 years old. He is married with six children. He has been a maize producer for the past seven years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support his labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his crop yield. With the profits from his farming he wishes to reinvest in his business so that in the future he can acquire different machines and a tractor that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support his labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 38 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to reinvest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and a tractor that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anayat

texts.en: Anayat is a 28-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. Anayat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. This will allow him to respond quickly to customer needs. He will put aside some of the profits to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Anayat hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 32-year-old married father of three children, who has been working in shoe sales for the past five years. In 2010, he opened his current shop, which he has worked hard to develop, to provide his children the best education and living and fulfill his customer’s needs.
Omar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business inventory with newly released winter collection.
Omar's shop is well known in the region, since he is the only one who runs such a business.
He is working hard to develop his business to make sure that he can cover all of his villagers needs.

loans.use: to increase his business inventory with newly released winter collection.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La joven Olga es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una mini  Pulpería y  venta de gallina y lo realiza desde hace 6 años.
Olga tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, arroz, manteca, frijoles, refrescos, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
Olga espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y con esta desea poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Olga su sueño un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
Olga is a young, hard-working, responsible woman who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family.  For six years she has been running a mini-market and selling chickens.

Olga's store is  set up in her house in the town where she lives.  She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, shortening, beans, soft drinks, etc. so she can continue working, since most of her income comes from the business.

She hopes to increase sales by having more stock on hand since she does not have the products necessary to fill customer orders on a daily basis.  She wants to improve her family's quality of life by increasing her income.  Her short-term goal is to expand the business and continue supporthing the family and giving her children the necessary education.


Honduras - October 2013

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, shortening, beans, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin, sigue cultivando la tierra y en esta ocasión necesita capital para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y plaguicidas, los cuales le ayudaran a tener muy bien preparada la tierra para la siembra.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo sembrar y recoger una abundante cosecha de maíz, sus ingresos aumentaron, amplio el área de siembra.
Hace un tiempo sufrió un accidente de motocicleta pero eso no fue motivo para dejar de trabajar y luchar por salir adelante, ya esta recuperado.
texts.en:
Melvin continues cultivating the land and occasionally needs capital to buy fertilizer, instecticide, herbicide, and pest control substance so he can treat the land for planting.

With the previous loan he was able to plant and harvest an abundant corn crop and increase his income.  He also expanded the crop area.  Some time ago he suffered a motorcycle accident but that was no reason to stop working and getting ahead.  He is now recovered.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide and pest control substance.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina Isabel es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad que desde niña se ha dedicado a apoyar a sus padres en las diferentes actividades que desarrolla en el campo como: limpieza, corte, fertilización, recolección, etc. Hoy en día junto a su compañero de hogar siguen ejerciendo las actividades que anteriormente se mencionan ya que en su comunidad es la única fuente de empleo y medio de ingreso para cada una de las familias. Ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian en el kínder de la comunidad teniendo ella un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el quinto grado por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres. Los cultivos de café que ella y su pareja trabajan son propios gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres los cuales están ubicados a 100 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando para poder asistirlos.
Ella sueña con ampliar la parcela de tierra que sus padres le heredaron con mucho mas producto, con una mejor variedad, más competitiva y más atractiva por lo que tiene la ilusión de mejorar sus ingresos parta el bienestar de su familia y el futuro de sus hijos. Es por ello que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 11 unidades de abono 18-46-0, 4 botes de abono foliar y 22 unidades de nutricafe con el cual protegerá y asistirá sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel, 24, is a young woman who since she was a child has helped her parents with the farm chores such as cutting, cleaning, fertilizing and crop harvesting.  Nowadays, together with her common-law partner, she continues with the same activity because in the community where she lives it is the only way to work and earn a living for the families.

She has two children who attend the kindergarten in the community and she, herself, received a fifth grade education thanks to her parents' moral and financial support. The coffee crops she and her partner have belong to the them as she inherited them from her parents.  The land is 100 meters from their house so they walk there to care for them.

Her dream is to add more products to the land she inherited from her parents.  She wants the crop to be of a better variety, more competitive and attractive.  Her goal is to improve her income for her family's well-being and the future of her children.  That is why she is now requesdting a loan to buy 11 units of fertilizer 18-46-0, 4 cans of plant fertlizer and 22 units of Nutricafe to protect and maintain the crops.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brigida, de 26 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijo a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su padre. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la siembra de papa, maíz y todo tipo de hortalizas, en terrenos agrícolas propios y alquilados. Aprovecha las largas jornadas en el campo para cuidar de sus animales como: vacas, toros, cerdos, “quien  sabe trabajar, dedica todo el día al cuidado de sus sembríos pues es importante tener de buena calidad”, comenta. Al mismo tiempo menciona que aprovecha los toros que posee, para hacer arado con la ayuda de su esposo. Asimismo cuenta que, el fin de semana aprovecha para vender comida, tiene muchos años cocinando y los comensales que visitan su puesto, consumen con frecuencia, de esa manera obtiene un dinero extra. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Brigida, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Brígida, 26, is an admirable woman who lives with her husband and children in the house she inherited from her parents.  Her main source of income is growing potatoes, corn and all types of vegetables on her own land as well as on rented land.  She takes advantage of the long workdays to care for her animals: cows, oxen, and pigs.  She says "People who know how to work dedicate their entire day to caring for the crops in order to get good quality."  She also takes advantage of the oxen to plough with her husband.

On weekends she sells food, as she has been cooking for many years and has frequent customers; so this is a way to earn extra income.  This is her first KIVA loan and she is very happy because she will have the necessary capital to improve her business and quality of life.  And, she enjoys being a member of the association because the other members are supportive, hard-working people.  She will use the 800 PEN loan to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, con el fin de aprovechar la próxima temporada de fin de año se está preparando para surtir su negocio con variedad de artículos, solicita capital para comprar ropa, juguetes, sombrillas y otros, teniendo lo necesario para ofrecer a su público sus beneficios serán los mismos que obtuvo con el crédito anterior como lo son mejores ganancias, un inventario muy completo, más clientes satisfechos y un negocio más competitivo.
Su familia se encuentra muy saludable y disfrutando de los cambios que han tenido en su economía, pues ya no tienen preocupaciones por deudas, ni por no contar con artículos que sus clientes necesitaban.
texts.en:
Teresa wants to take advantage of the upcoming end of year holiday season to stock her business with a variety of articles.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, toys, sun umbrellas, etc. so she can have everything she needs to offer to her customers.  The advantages will be the same as those she obtained with the previous loan which are more profits, a very complete inventory, satisfied customers and a competitive business.

Her family is very healthy and enjoying the changes they have had in their economy, since they do not have to worry about debts.  And Teresa does not have to worry about not having the merchandise her customers need.

loans.use: To buy clothing, toys, sun umbrellas, etc.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
Василь – из Виноградово. Уже не первый год занимается тепличным хозяйством, держит 3 теплицы – одна размером в 2 сотки, другие – по 2 сотки. В теплицах Василь выращивает цветы и огурцы. Наемных рабочих не берет, в бизнесе задействована вся семья. Земельный участок находится прямо возле дома. 
Сумма в 15 000 гривен понадобилась Василю для того, чтобы обновить состояние теплиц и купить все нужное для сельскохозяйственного сезона, а именно купить пленку на теплицу, а также семена цветов и огурцов, горшки и дрова для отопления внутри теплиц. Со временем Василь планирует сконструировать еще одну теплицу, так как земля для этого есть.
texts.en: Vasil is from Vinogradovo.  He is an experienced greenhouse grower who has three greenhouses - one has two arches, and others are one arch apiece.  Vasil grows flowers and cucumbers in his greenhouses.  He does not have any staff, since his whole family is involved in the business.  His plot is located right next to his house.  Vasil needs 15,000 hryvnas to make repairs to his greenhouses and to buy everything he needs for the growing season, specifically plastic film for the greenhouses and seeds for flowers, cucumbers, peas and firewood to heat the greenhouses.  In time, Vasil plans to build another greenhouse, as he has the land for it.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film, seeds, pots and wood for greenhouses

loans.name: Kadior Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe fait partie d'un banc villageois inauguré le 23 Mars 2013. Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui ont une même vision et une bonne progression en épargne et en crédit. Madame Sounkarou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et mère d'une fille de 17 ans. Elle s'active dans la vente d'habit depuis plusieurs années. Elle est couturière au village artisanal. Elle va acheter avec le prêt demandé 25 pièces de tissu. Les serviront de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de sa fille.
texts.en: This group is part of the village bank inaugurated 23 march 2013. This group is comprised of women with similar vision and a good progression of credit and savings. Mrs Sounkarou, seen in the far right in the photo raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is a 50 year old married woman and mother of a 17 year old girl. She has been selling clothing for several years. She is a seamstress in an artisanal village. She plans to use this loan to purchase 25 pieces of fabric. Profits will be used to take care of the education costs of her daughter.

loans.use: purchase clothes

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is 25 years old. He is married with one child. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 42 years old. He is married with seven children. With the Kiva loan, he will pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Françoise Paul's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Françoise Paul (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46 ans. Françoise Paul est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Hervé. Le couple a un enfant à sa charge, qui n'est pas scolarisé. Françoise Paul vit avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Françoise Paul et son mari. Françoise Paul est une coiffeuse. Parallèlement, Françoise Paul vend des tissus et des chaussures dans sa boutique à son domicile. Françoise Paul s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et aussi au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Françoise Paul s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three women living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Françoise Paul (seen in the photo with her hand raised), is 46 years old. Françoise is married to a window fitter named Hervé. The couple has one child, who does not attend school. Françoise Paul lives with her husband her child. All needs of the family are shared by both parents. Françoise Paul is a hairdresser. On the side, she also sells fabric and shoes from her home. She stocks up on merchandise at markets in Benin and Togo. In order to reinforce her activity, Françoise Paul is collaborating with other members of her group in order to ask for their first loan from ALIDE.

loans.use: purchase hair extensions, fabric and shoes

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 50 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa, age 26, is a mother of four children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money he finds it difficult. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

For that reason, his wife, Saiqa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and new variety of embroidery materials. Saiqa is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and new variety of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela, age 47, is from the village of Dighomi, where she lives with her 18-year-old son. Natela’s son is a cook in a restaurant and Natela works as a dishwasher. Both of the family members get a monthly salary and they don’t have their own business. Natela works throughout each day to generate income, but her earnings are too small to save and improve the family's standard of living. The family lives below the poverty line and receives a small amount of social assistance from the local government. 

Natela would like to start up a clothing sales business in her community in order to earn an additional income. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices to start her new business. Since there are not many clothing stores in her village, Natela is confident that her endeavor will meet a high demand. She intends to develop positive relationships with her customers and expects to attain a good profit from her new business. This start-up loan offers Natela a good chance to earn a more stable income and improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing and start a trading business in her community.

loans.name: Eugénie's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Eugénie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans. Eugénie est mariée à un certain Henri. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont un à leur charge. Eugénie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Eugénie vend depuis trente ans, divers produits vivriers (maïs, riz, haricot, huile végétale) dans une région du Bénin. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Eugénie sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres de son groupe. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: This group is comprised of four friends. The representative of the group, Eugénie (seen in the photo with her hand raised) is 58 years old. Eugénie is married to a man named Henri. The couple have four children, one of whom they are still responsible for. Eugénie did not attend school. In order to cover the family's needs, Eugénie has been selling diverse food supplies (corn, rice, beans, vegetable oil) for the past thirty years. She stocks up on merchandise in the market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her activity, Eugénie is asking for her first loan from ALIDE, together with the other members of her group. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer requests and increase their profits.

loans.use: purchase food supplies (corn, rice, beans, vegetable oil)

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 43 years old. He is a father of four children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
Devis, who is in his mid 50s is married with four sons two of them are still at school. He has been running a general store since 1995. He works from 06.00am to 08.00pm each working day and and is able to make a fair return each month. 

This is Devis's eleventh loan request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzani. He will use it to buy more stock for the general store, fix the fridge and the door of the premises where he puts his business fridge. With the previous loans all of which he paid back successfully, he restocked his general store with missing items so as to maintain his sales level. Devis used his business profit to pay college fees for his children, reinvested in the business and saved for his retirement benefits. He started building a house for renting. Devis dreams that one day will be able to finish building his house for renting and to have a better life. 

Devis will share this loan with his loan group "Maclaren" which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the general store, fix the fridge and the door of the premises where he keeps his fridge.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 47 years old. He has been a rice farmer for the past twenty years. With the Kiva loan, he would like to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and son in a small village of Sachkhere district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they have walnut trees, maize and haricot beans. They work hard to have a good harvest, which is sold to local retailers. Her husband and son also work as artisans and get small additional income. 

Svetlana decided to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3,100 GEL to purchase two cows. When the cows are purchased, Svetlana will start producing cheese to sell. The Start-up loan will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 48 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Maria Haidee

texts.es:
María, tiene 29 años, es una madre que disfruta de sus tres hijos junto a su esposo. Debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, se decidió por salir a vender tamales de elote en el centro de la cuidad y en sus alrededores, para ella no se le hace difícil esta actividad la respalda mucho tiempo de experiencia y la administrado muy bien.
Comprar elotes, aceite, leña y ollas; para poder elaborar una mayor cantidad de productos, con esto tendrá mejores ingresos, aumento en sus ventas y materia prima para trabajar y cumplir con sus compromisos.
María aspira a tener un negocio más amplio para que su economía sea estable y forjar un futuro con muchas oportunidades en la educación de sus hijos y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and a happy mother to the three children she has with her husband. Owing to the need to make money to help her husband with household expenses, she decided to go sell sweet corn tamales in the city center and surrounding areas. This was not a difficult thing for her, since she has long experience behind her and knows very well what she is doing. 

 Buying corn on the cob, oil, firewood, and pots, so she can prepare more products, will allow her to make more money. She can also increase her sales and raw materials for working with, and this way she can fulfill her commitments. Maria aspires to expand her business in order to have stable finances and forge a future full of educational opportunities for her children and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn on the cob, oil, firewood, and pots

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, a hardworking father of two living in Fort Portal, Uganda, is  a farmer and also works as a catechist in a local church. Like most farmers, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations, while his desire is to diversify his farming activities to include both annual and perennial crops. John is requesting a loan to plant maize to sell.

loans.use: To plant maize

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 41-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in involved the transport business, alongside farming, in order to boost his income. 

He faces challenges of prolonged rainy seasons that make roads impassible and high cost of fuel, while his dreams are to own at least four motorcycles which he intends to hire out and the riders will be expected to remit 80% of the daily earnings. Thomas intends to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Cyriaque

texts.en:
Cyriaque, a 40-year-old married father of three, is requesting a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to increase rice production and support farm labor costs. He wishes to reinvest profits into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and sister. His family have been IDP (internally displacted persons) from Füzuli city for twenty years and now live in Bala Bahmanli village of Füzuli. Yashar’s mother Husniya is a housewife who helps Yashar in his business. His father Ali is a taxi driver and sister Gunay is a tailor.

Yashar has been in the animal breeding business for three years. He buys little cows, raises them, and sells them in the local bazaar to earn money to live on. Yashar wants to develop his business, so he needs 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more cows.

Yashar is thankful for this aid from Komak and Kiva organizations. He wants to buy more cows and in the future to produce dairy products and sell them.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 39-year-old married lady. She has expertise in hand embroidery and has been using her skills to provide financial support to her family for many years. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough of money to purchase the required material. 

Today, she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of RKR 30000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Misbha

texts.en:
Misbha is vigorous lady and a mother of four children. 

She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sheher

texts.en:
Sheher is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man who works in the agriculture business to make his living. Mohamad has an agricultural tractor that he uses to help farmers in doing necessary agricultural work.  He also works in transporting students to and from school as an additional income business. Mohamad is a hard worker who seeks perfection in both businesses to make sure that they will provide him with a good living. 

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his tractor, which is his main source of living.
