Mohamad is working hard to hard to keep on developing his businesses to make sure that, in the future, he'll have a wide agricultural services company in addition to a transportation company.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his tractor.

loans.name: Zaheen

texts.en:
Zaheen is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. 

She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children in future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 36-year-old married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to meet the demands of her customers on time. 

She is in her second loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to provide a better standard of living to her four children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hafiizan

texts.en: Hafiizan had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began sewing work in her house. She sews for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She is the mother six children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, health and clothing.  She has now attained a regular list of customers but due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase more spools of thread, along with the packs of lace and ribbons. These will help her to sew more dresses in less time. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of lace and ribbons.

loans.name: Cesar Vallejo De V.e.s Group

texts.es: Inés  de 43  Años de edad soltera y sin hijos, Inés  se dedica hace  3 años al servicio de costura remalle, Inés  confecciona prendas de vestir, en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y salir adelante, Inés   a sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Inés solicito el préstamo para comprar telas y poder  confeccionar ropa  de vestir a la vez  Inés   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Inés  esta parada y se le distingue por su pantalón marrón,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Inés, 43, is single and doesn't have children. For three years, she has worked by repairing clothing. Inés makes clothing in a small rented space with the goal of moving forward. Inés knew how to gain customers so she can improve her quality of life.

Inés is requesting this loan to buy fabric for dressmaking. Inés and all the other members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for for believing in them. In the photo, Inés is standing and wearing brown pants. She promises to fulfill all her goals.

loans.use: to buy fabric for dressmaking

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is age 32. He is a father of four, three of whom go to school. With the loan, he would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs to buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to pay labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 30-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for the past seven years. She has four buffalo and one cow, which she uses for milk for the people of her locality. Bushra has become famous for providing good-quality milk and she makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five. 

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is married and the mother of five. 

She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community.

Samina has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stocks of different cloth for the winter season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Nawab

texts.en:
Nawab, age 35, has been doing business making shoes for many years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is running her business with the support of her husband and makes enough to provide the basic necessities for her five children, including food, health and education. 

It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy additional material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market. She wishes to spend part of the revenue she makes on providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy additional material to make shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have six children. He would like to use the Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Dyanah Wared 50430 Group

texts.en:
Hind is the featured borrower of Dyanah Wared 50430 Group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Hind is a 41-year-old married mother of two children. She works as an accountant to support her husband who works in pasting floor tiles. Hind's loan will be invested in paying for her children school tuition fees. Hind is the first lady standing at the left side.

As for the other group members, Nisrine is the second from the left, Diana is the lady in red, and Noura is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 31-year-old married woman. 

She has a business manufacturing "waan," which is a thread-like material used in making wooden bed frames on four legs. She offers various types of "waan" in different colors and has become famous for providing good quality material in her community. 

Nargis operates the machine at home with the help of her husband and is able to manage her household efficiently.  

This is her third year with Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is applying for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy another machine to make "waan" with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales. She is hopeful to get boost in her earnings and wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make "waan."

loans.name: Asmati

texts.en:
Asmati, age 42, is a widow from the village of Vardisubani ("street of roses" in English) where she lives with her two children. She is actively involved in an agricultural business and cultivates a piece of land where eggplants are grown. Asmati sells her produce locally. Besides that, she rents agricultural land to earn income and feed her children. 

 In order to meet her increasing family expenses, Asmati decided to start her own business. Asmati has noticed a high demand for used clothing in the market as local people can’t afford to buy new clothing due to their poverty. In response to the local market demand, she has requested a loan to purchase stock of used clothing to sell among her community members with a price mark-up. She plans to invest the profit in the same business and develop it in the future. Asmati hopes this loan will change her life.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Asima

texts.en: Asima is 30 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past five years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Tahsina

texts.en:
Ms. Tehsina is a married woman who is living with her husband in Punjab, Pakistan. For about 5 years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Tehsina dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is now living in a rented house with her family. She is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat, age 25, has dealt in the business of selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to generate more profits so she can better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Victorina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Victorina, es una mujer que lucha por salir adelante con sus hijos de 2, 4 y 6 años, es una madre soltera que vive con sus padres y se ha visto en la necesidad de emprender un  negocio propio para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos, hace mucho tiempo se empezó a vender accesorio de uso personal lo inicio por cuenta propia y no se le dificulta realizar está actividad porque es algo que disfruta hacerlo.
Invertirá en la compra de ganchos, diademas, moños, peines, aretes de bisutería, etc., con lo que surtirá sus productos y podrá cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio, salir de la deuda, dar a sus hijos mejor alimentación, educación, y salud.
texts.en:
Victorina is a woman working hard to move forward with her children ages 2, 4, and 6. She is a single mother who lives with her parents and saw the need to start her own business to cover her children's expenses. A long time ago, she started selling personal accessories. She started on her own and it was easy for her to decide on this sector because she enjoys doing it.

She will invest in buying hooks, hairbands, ribbons, combs, earrings, and more. This will help her stock up on products to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of growing her business, getting out of debt, and giving her children better food, education, and health.

loans.use: to buy hooks, hairbands, ribbons, combs, earrings, and more.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 28-year-old married man. He lives in the Telavi district with his wife and mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. His wife works as a sales lady at a local pharmacy and gets 350 Gel per month. 

Zurab is unemployed now, in spite of having a high education diploma. He decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $4,500 for purchasing a car. Once the car is purchased, he will serve local people as a taxi driver and will generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Kongowea area north of Mombasa Kenya. He is 36 years old and married with four children. He runs a retail shop in the market and the business has been in operation for two years now. 

Thomas wants to buy cereals and soap for his business. He knew Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he can be able to access funding for his business. He hopes that the business will grow in to a wholesale business in the next five years despite the challenges of competition and price instability. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living and also educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cereals and soap

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years. He has spent six years in the farming field. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production

loans.name: Miracle's Group

texts.en:
Miracles Group is currently in its forth loan cycle. They sell products like dippers, ladies' shoes, cooking oil, gari (cassava flour), beans and electrical gadgets.

Gladys is 44 years old, married and has two children. She is the group representative and she sells electrical gadgets from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day. Her effort has earned her good customers who order regularly and are very satisfied with her service.
 
Gladys' dream is to have a well equipped shop so that she can keep working and gain more customers and earn more profit.

Gladys has asked for this loan so that she can purchase CD players and radios to sell to her customers. This will help her keep working as she strives to grow and improve life for herself and her family.

Gladys, together with eight others, will need GHS 6,800 to buy stock and improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase CD players and radios to sell.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 38-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of fabrics from the main city and then sells to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Haseena requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different sorts of cloth for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different fabrics for the winter season.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is a 55-year-old widow and a mother of three. She has been involved in business selling cloth in her community for a period of about 6 years. Zubida buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Zubida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of fabrics in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Zubida expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of fabrics in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 59 years old and married. She has been doing a business of bangles sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income. 

Rani has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Huma

texts.en: Huma is a married woman who has run a beauty parlour for five years. She offers many services to her customers such as make-up, hair styling and facials and has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for her parlour. But because of her lack of cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for a loan. She needs a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. With these, she is hopeful of consistently catering for more customers. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products but also be able to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of clothes in different colors and sizes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

Saima is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes in different colors and sizes for the winter season.

loans.name: Heydar

texts.en:
Heydar is a 53-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been in agricultural for more than 29 years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. His main engagement is corn sowing. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family.

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. 

Heydar has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenues in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.en:
Paulina is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Paulina was born in Teshie township, in a coastal part of Ghana, 38 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children; all are attending primary and junior high school. 

For six years now, Paulina has been operating a cold store by selling both fish and meat. 

She and her group members have applied for a loan of GHS 2,400 to expand their businesses. 

Paulina will use her share of the loan (GHS 800) to buy more fish from the harbor to stock her cold store.

loans.use: To buy more fish from the harbor to stock her cold store.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (the man shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of two children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
After graduating primary school, Florence decided to set up her own provisions business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over three years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more provisions for resale. 

Florence aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Dirar

texts.en:
Dirar is a 53-year-old married father of one child who has been working as a school bus driver since 2005. He has also worked in furniture making for forty years, but the low income from that business forced him to work in the transportation sector for additional income.

Dirar is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his child's school registration fees, tuition fees, books and stationery. His good reputation provides him  customers support and loyalty.

He hopes that one day he'll buy a bigger bus where he can serve more customers and at the same time increase his income.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school registration fees, tuition fees, books and stationery

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Betty is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fabric in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. 

Betty is married and has four children; her husband works as a mechanic. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, and pay their children’s school fees. 

Betty wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric. 

In the long term, Betty plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.es:
Doña  Pricila  es una persona responsable, trabajadora  y  honesta, vive  con su  hijo en  una aldea  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta   coronas para difunto  las cuales vende desde su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante.  
Doña  Pricila  tiene más de más de 20  años de tener su negocio, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de materia de flores, papelio, tape, etc. para seguir realizando su negocio. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
La señora  Pricila  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en al más reconocido de su comunidad.
 

Choluteca, Honduras  –Octubre   del   2013
texts.en:
Pricila is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her son in a town in southern Honduras. Her business is in wreath making for funerals. She has sold these from her home and by traveling.

Pricila has over 20 years of experience in this business. This loan is to buy flowers, paper, tape, and other items to continue with her business. With this loan, she hopes that sales from her business will increase from having more products to offer and being able to attend to more customers.

Pricila hopes to cover the cost of necessities and improve her and her family's quality of life. In a few years, she hopes that her business keeps growing and becomes more recognized in her community.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy flowers, paper, tape, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel is age 48. He is a father of three. With the Kiva loan, he would like to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda; he used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children.

John's main business is selling second-hand clothing, in addition to farming as an additional income source. He faces challenges of limited capital, however, he has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning and owning a modern boutique. 

John intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is 45 years old; he is married with four children. He has been a maize farmer for the past six years. 

He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs, and to buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer, and to support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
This is Maya, who is 44 years old and lives in Tbilisi city. She is married with one child. Maya and her husband are running a car rental business and earn a monthly income. As their earnings are not enough to cover utilities and food costs, Maya has decided to diversify the business and start up a small café, where doner will be sold. Doner (kebab/sandwich/gyro) has become a very popular fast-food dish in the last several years in Georgia. 

According to Maya’s estimation, sales will be high as the location where she plans to start her cafe is crowded with people. She has already hired the commercial space and needs money to purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials. The income from the café will be a great support for the family as it will generate additional income. Maya appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a food cafe.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 25 years old, married and mother of one. She runs a grocery store in town that has been operation for the last six years. This business is the only economic activity that she does and it feeds her family. She hopes that the business will grow in to wholesale in the next five years despite the challenges of perishability of the goods and bad debts. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy three bags of kale, one carton of tomatoes and three kilograms of onions. The income that she will earn will pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy three bags of kale, one carton of tomatoes and three kilograms of onions.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a married lady who sells animals in her community. She buys animals, such as baby goats, at low prices and brings them up and sells them in the market at higher prices. Shahnaz makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She is very experienced and has good market contacts. 

Shahnaz is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to purchase two more goats to improve her business and provide for her household expenses. She will use her loan to definitely expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase two goats

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a small scale food vendor in Adientem (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has six children. Her husband works in construction. 

Patience has been working as a food vendor for close to twenty years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of food ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of food ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a small scale food vendor in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a soldier. Janet has been working as a food vendor for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of food ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of food ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth sells clothing in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been educated thru the end of junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in construction. Ruth has been working in this enterprise for three years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her clothing enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 27 years old. He is a hardworking married man who lives in Hoima, Uganda. Godfrey runs a produce business and has been able to provide the basics for his family with the proceeds from his business. He is a good father who desires to educate his children through university. Godfrey also wants to start a number of sustainable, income-generating activities. His major business challenges include the high cost of transport and price fluctuation.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell. In the future, he wants to become a model farmer in his village.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Ms Abida is a 38-year-old married woman whose husband is a labourer. She has five children and a total of seven members in her household but her husband was previously the only income earner of the family. It was very tough for Abida to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Thus she decided to help her husband by starting a business selling spreads, bed sheets and pillow covers. She brings different verities from a wholesale market and sells them in her area. She wants a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase a greater variety of bed covers and spreads to cater for the tastes and choices of her customers. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bed covers and spreads.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is divorced and has four children. After successfully graduating primary school, Patience is now an established businesswoman. She sells bread in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about eleven years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Patience uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Patience will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bread, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bread for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married to a construction worker and has five children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Evelyn currently sells vegetables in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over eleven years of experience in this trade, Evelyn sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more vegetables, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Evelyn wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her vegetable enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán  de 25 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad Administración de negocios internacionales  que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Hernán está culminando sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen administrador. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en seguir pagando su matrícula, para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Hernán   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Hernán is 25, single and has no children. He is a likable student in the International Business Administration department who studies a great deal to achieve his goals in life. He is successfully completing his studies to be a good administrator.

Hernán will use the loan to continue paying his tuition, for university housing and to buy the school supplies he needs. He is very grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the help provided and takes his leave eager to achieve his goals

loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old and is married with two children. She is a farmer. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.  

Beatrice is requesting a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize. She needs fertilizer to increase her production. With profits from her farm, Beatrice wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors to improve her capacity and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce maize

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 34 years old and is married with six children. He is a farmer. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

Faustin is requesting a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer to produce maize. He needs fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farm, Faustin wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors to improve his capacity and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce maize

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widow and has four children. After successfully graduating primary school, Grace is now an established businesswoman. She sells fish and vegetables in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Grace uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Grace will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish and vegetables, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina operates an egg-selling business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Selina is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Selina uses her income to provide for the entire family. Selina will use the loan to purchase more eggs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Selina understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
After graduating senior high school, Mary decided to set up her own second-hand clothing business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over ten years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more second-hand clothing for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a plumber) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is a 62-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village of Tsnori district with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Her son works for a building company and gets 300 GEL per month. Makvala's husband is provided with a retirement pension. Makvala works physically and gets small daily salary. 

She decided to start family business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 GEL for purchasing calves. When the calves are purchased, she will raise them and and will start producing dairy products. She already has a shed in the yard where the calves will be housed. The Start Up loan will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Krowor 1 Group

texts.en:
Roberta has three children who live with her in the family home. She is a member of the "Krowor 1" Group, which is located in the town of Teshie. The town's economy depends on fishing and trading, and it is one of the busiest business areas in Ghana. The main activities of group members are selling clothes, chicken, meat, pork, plastic products, maize, slippers, cosmetics, and mineral drinks. Roberta loves going to work and church. She works selling chicken and her greatest challenge now is to have her own house. Roberta set up her business with a small amount of her savings and her first loan with ID-Ghana. She successfully repaid her first loan which gave her a step forward to growing her business which she has had for almost two years.

Roberta will use her portion of the 6,300 GHS group loan to buy chicken meat to supply her customers. She is very excited to be receiving her second loan from ID-Ghana. She plans to use the profits from her loan to buy things she needs and start building her house.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to supply her customers

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is married with three children. Her husband works as a driver. Although she has received no prior formal education, Diana is an entrepreneur who sells used clothing in Adentem, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Diana is requesting a loan to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of used clothing. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married with three children. Her husband is a mechanic. Vida received some schooling through the end of primary school. For the past three years, Vida has sold onions in Adentem, near Cape Coast. Her income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Vida is requesting a loan to buy onions to increase her capacity. With the new profits from her loan, Vida plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married to a carpenter and has one child. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. A junior high school graduate, Vida currently sells sandals in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over one year of experience in this trade, Vida sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her stock. 

Thus her loan will be used to buy more sandals, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Vida wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her sandal enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more sandals for resale

loans.name: Nika

texts.en:
Nika, age 28, is from a suburb of Tbilisi city. He is single and lives with his parents and two sisters. Nika is employed at a furniture workshop and gets a small monthly salary.  He works hard there but often the employer is not able to pay him.  That is the reason why Nika decided to start up his own workshop and make furniture. He has already hired a garage where he plans to start his workshop. His father will assist him in this business since he makes furniture as well and has proper experience in that field. 

With the received amount, Nika will purchase all the needed equipment and make furniture for sale: sofas, chairs and other items. He hopes his project will be lucrative and have many orders. Nika will generate stable income and be financially independent. 

He is a hard-working and enthusiastic young man who wishes to get ahead. Nika hopes that his life will change after the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to start up a furniture workshop

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married to a driver and has six children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. A primary school graduate, Georgina currently sells sandals in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over one year of experience in this trade, Georgina sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her stock. 

Thus her loan will be used to buy more sandals, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Georgina wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her sandal enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more sandals for resale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Augustina did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Augustina sells fruit in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Augustina is married to a driver and has one child. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their child’s school fees. 

Augustina has identified that there is growing demand among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Augustina wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her child will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with four children. Her husband is a construction worker. For the past two years, Vivian has been a small-scale grocer in Adentem, near Cape Coast. She has had some form of formal education as she is a senior high school graduate. Vivian’s income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Vivian is requesting a loan to purchase groceries to sell to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her loan to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is married with two children. Her husband is a construction worker. For the past two years, Theresa had sold plantains in Adentem, near Cape Coast. She has been educated till the end of senior high school. Theresa is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Theresa is requesting a loan to buy more plantains to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her loan to grow her plantain business and increase her capital base. In the long run, Theresa wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to buy more plantains to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Elizabeth did not have access to formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Elizabeth sells provisions in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a carpenter, and together they have one child. Elizabeth uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

 Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Elizabeth wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her child is able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of provisions

loans.name: Jerisha Malish

texts.en:
Jerisha is forty years old and is married. Her family has five children, three of whom attend school. 

She has been in business for at least four years selling mixed merchandise in her retail shop. She has a variety of goods on display and this contributed to an increased customer base. She is organized and has room for expansion, given additional capital for financing more merchandise.

She has serviced one loan with Finance Sudan Limited and paid in a timely manner. She learned about Finance Sudan Limited through old clients and would like to use the opportunity to expand her business through increasing stock for resale.

loans.use: To pay for beer, soda, soap, sugar, and bread

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Adriana, durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, inició vendiendo empanadas y otros alimentos fritos, poco a poco fue cambiando de artículos y comenzó a vender ropa, accesorios hasta que desde hace 4 años vio la oportunidad de abrir una tienda en su propia casa, pues la unidad residencial donde vive carecía de este servicio, allí ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y poco a poco fue incluyendo nuevos artículos que sus clientes demandaban; esta actividad la desarrolla de manera empírica, trabaja sola y es apasionada por su labor, pues le gusta generar sus propios ingresos, con los cuales apoya a su esposo para llevar la carga económica del hogar y para brindarle a su hijo una buena educación. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, gaseosas, productos de aseo, lácteos, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer la demanda que aumenta cada día; esto le dará paso a generar mejores utilidades por cada venta y tendrá la oportunidad de seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de adquirir un local propio para independizar el negocio de su unidad familiar, pues desea poder generar empleo y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y de las demás personas que influyen en la labor.
texts.en:
Throughout her working life Adriana has been an independent businesswoman. She started out selling empanadas and other fried foods, and then gradually moved into selling clothing and accessories. Then four years ago she saw the opportunity of opening a store in her own home as the community in which she lives didn't have a corner store. She sells daily necessities and is gradually introducing other items requested by her customers. Adriana is expanding her store based on this information. She works alone and loves her job as she likes to have an income of her own with which to help her husband with household expenses and provide her son with a good education.

Adriana is now seeking a loan to help her buy more stock at wholesale prices (baked goods, cookies, soft drinks, cleaning products, milk products etc.) then she will have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her customers and satisfy their increasing demands. She will earn more money and have the opportunity to progress towards fulfilling her dream of owning premises independent of her home. She also wishes to provide jobs, as well as improve her family's and other families' standard of living.

loans.use: buy more stock at wholesale prices (baked goods, cookies, soft drinks, cleaning products, milk products etc

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila es una mujer de 34 años de edad la cual es madre de dos hijos, casad que acompaña de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura siendo su especialidad la siembra, cultivo y venta de café. Ella tiene 4 años de educación primaria los cuales pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero de sus padres siendo ellos los mismos que le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad y también algunas capacitaciones con diversas instituciones que se dedican a capacitar personas del campo para mejorar sus técnicas de cultivo. Sus cultivos están ubicados cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando para dar asistencia y mantenimiento. Uno de sus grandes desafíos es el incremento de precios en el mercado para los insumos que ella utiliza para asistir sus cultivos de café ya que la competencia no la considera como un problema.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder seguir ampliando más sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de terreno con lo que mejorara sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y poder ahorrar un capital para poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad.
Es por esa razón que actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como urea, formula 18-46-0, nutrí café entre otros que ayudaran al desarrollo y protección de sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Domitila, 34, is the mother of two children. She is married and lives with her husband. They both work in agriculture and their specialty is planting, harvesting, and selling coffee. She went to school through fourth grade in primary school, which she was able to complete due to financial help from her parents. Her parents taught her to work the land from a young age in addition to some other skills from various institutions that work to help people in the country build cultivation skills. Her crops are near her home, which she gets to by walking to care for them and perform maintenance. One of her biggest challenges is the rising prices in the market for supplies that she uses to help her coffee crops. Her competition doesn't consider this to be a problem.

Her plans for the future are to increase her coffee crop size by buying land. This will increase her income for the well-being of her family and allow her to save capital so she can send her children to college.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy agriculture supplies such as urea, 18-46-0 formula, nutrí café and other items that will help her grow and protect her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies to use on and improve her coffee crops.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
After graduating primary school, Vida decided to set up her own provisions and bread business in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). With over five years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more provisions and bread for resale. 

Vida aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a construction worker) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and bread for resale.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a 33-year-old hard-working client from Iraq. He is married, has two children, and provides the family's income alone.

Hussain has a blacksmith's shop, where he makes doors and windows to order. He has been in this field since his childhood and established his own business in 2011. Hussain has much experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to buy a generator and a specialized piece of equipment for his job. Hussain is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may educate his children and provide them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a specialized piece of equipment for his job

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old and has two children. Majid is a grocer and provides for his family alone.

In his grocery store, Majid provides the needs of his neighborhood by selling them dairy products, canned food, snacks, drinks and detergents. He has been in this field since 2011 and has gained much experience in what he practices. Majid has a hired employee and thanks to his competitive prices, he became well-known in the neighborhood and has earned an excellent reputation.

Majid is applying for a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. Najid is an ambitious person. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store

loans.name: Krowor 2 Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Krowor 2” group from Teshie-Accra, a town in the coastal region of Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of GHS 6750 as a total amount for the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. They are in the fields of  foodstuffs, provisions, underwear, slippers, second-hand clothing, wax prints, wigs, charcoal, cooking oil and plastic bowls. 

Evelyn is the featured leader of this group. The 44-year-old is single with two adult children. Evelyn has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells second-hand clothing and wax prints. With her share of this loan, she will buy one bale of second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

This is the group's second loan cycle with ID-Ghana and they repaid their previous loan promptly and without trouble.

loans.use: To buy one bale of second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Delma Eliza

texts.es:
Doña Delma es una mujer de 41 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completada cursado hasta el 2 grado madre soltera de 1 hijo el cual es menor de edad y no tiene edad para estudiar. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace más de 10 años actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres por lo que ella a muy temprana edad decidió aprender ya que es una actividad rentable tomando en cuenta que el precio del café en el mercado sea bien pagado, sin embargo no deja de obtener ingresos para el sustento de su hijo aunque el precio sea malo. Sus clientes son vecinos, amigos e intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto ya que el clima es apto y la tierra es fértil por lo que al final de la temporada el grano es muy bueno de la mano con la atención brindada por su parte mediante la aplicación de insumos agrícolas siendo estos su mayor desafió por la inestabilidad de precios en el mercado ya que la competencia no es problema.
Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento para poder comprar los insumos necesario para poder seguir asistiendo sus cultivos de café como lo ha hecho hasta hoy en día ya que de esa manera ella podrá obtener un buen grano al final de la temporada.
Sus metas son las de poder aplicar el insumo a sus cultivos de café protegiendo estos de bichos, plagas, heladas evitando que el grano se deteriore y se pierdan horas y días de trabajo. También poder comprar con las ganancias otra clase de plantilla para poder cultivar una variedad diferente de café y ofrecer a sus clientes para su compra/venta; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a su hijo convertido en profesional teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Delma is a 41 year old fighter who completed one year of Primary school. She didn't finish Grade 2. She is the single mother of one young child who is not yet of school age. She has grown coffee for the past 10 years. It is something that her parents taught her to do at a very early age since it is a profitable activity. Keep in mind that coffee is very well paid on the market and it has allowed her enough revenues to support her child even when prices are low.

Her clients are her neighbors, friends or middlemen who come to the area searching for good product as the climate is suitable and the soil is fertile. By harvest time the berries are very good thanks to the attention given them, part of this being the application of  agricultural supplies. Her major challenge is the instability of prices in the market. Competition is not a problem. 

Delma is requesting a loan today to be able to buy the supplies necessary to be able to continue protecting her coffee crops as she has done up to now. In this way she gets good beans at harvest time. 

Her goals are to be able to apply the supplies to her coffee crops to protect them against insects, infestations and frost so the berries don't get destroyed and the hours and days of her labor wasted. Also with the revenues generated she can buy another type of plant to grow a different variety of coffee to offer her buyers. Her priority is to see her son become a professional having a good education and the possibility of a better future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 35 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase the production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and supports labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a small-scale yam seller in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a clearing agent. Martha has been selling yams for close to eight years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Martha plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of yams, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a yam stand, allowing her to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of yams for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married with three children. She has received some schooling up to the end of primary school. Currently, Patricia sells provisions in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about twenty years now. Her husband is a security officer. 

Patricia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Patricia will use the loan to increase her existing provisions capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Patricia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing provisions capacity.

loans.name: Luismel Reynaldo

texts.es:
Luismel Reynaldo es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Industrial, él está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar todos sus gastos de educación, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Luismel, tengo 21 años, vivo en La Vega donde nací y crecí, tengo 2 hermanos y soy soltero sin hijos, mis padres son de escasos recursos, mi madre trabaja como enfermera en el hospital de La Vega y mi padre realiza trabajos ambulatorios.
Actualmente estoy cursando el 8vo cuatrimestre de Ingeniería Industrial en UCATECI, de mi carrera me gustan las materias de producción, método y mantenimiento.
El préstamo KIVA-FUNDAPEC sería la solución a mis problemas ya que sin este no podría seguir estudiando, no tengo un trabajo con que pagarme la carrera y con lo que ganan mis padres a penas nos da para sobrevivir.
Mi meta es llegar a ser un gran profesional y poder aportar a la sociedad mis conocimientos, aportar mi granito de arena para que muchos dominicanos puedan salir de la extrema pobreza en que viven.
texts.en:
Luismel Reynaldo is studying industrial engineering. He is seeking a loan to pay for educational expenses. Here is his story: 'My name is Luismel. I am 21 years old and live in La Vega where I was born and raised. I am single and have no children. My parents are poor: my mother is a nurse at the La Vega hospital and my father sells goods in the streets of the town.

I am now in the 8th semester of an industrial engineering course at UCATECI. I enjoy studying about production materials, methods, and maintenance.

A loan from Kiva-FUNDAPEC would be the solution to my problems as without it I would not be able to continue studying. I do not have a job with which to support myself while I study, and my parents barely earn enough to live on. My goal is to get a good professional job and be able to use my knowledge in society. I want to do my share so that many Dominicans can leave behind the poverty in which they live.

loans.use: Pay for the costs of his industrial engineering courses

loans.name: Liticia

texts.en: Liticia is divorced and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Liticia is a successful businesswoman. She sells provisions in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Liticia uses her income to provide for the entire family. Liticia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Liticia plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Matilda is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for seven years. Matilda is married and has three children. Her husband works as a painter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Matilda will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Matilda plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a food vendor in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a mechanic) support their three children. She has been involved in food vending for three years now.

She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of food ingredients, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to both find better markets for her food vending enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of food ingredients, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana operates a fabric selling business in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). Diana is a divorcee with two children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Diana uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Diana will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Diana understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 35-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and two sons, in a small village of Sachkhere district. Her sons go to the local school. Her husband is an artisan and gets orders to produce mirror frames to sell.

Nadia decided to a start a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 700 GEL. She will use the loan to purchase cheese, to begin trade. Nadia will have a stable income, after her trading business has been started.

loans.use: to purchase cheese to sell and start up a new business

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 45 years old. He is a father of three. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase the production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Vicentia

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Vicentia did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.

Currently, Vicentia sells provisions in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. As a divorcee with two children, Vicentia uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Vicentia will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Vicentia wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Doña Elia tiene una edad de 45 años es casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que su economía no era la mejor para que ella pudiese continuar. Ella se dedica al negocio del cultivo de café desde hace 6 años aprendiendo por medio de una institución que se dedica a capacitar a los agricultores enseñándoles a mejorar las técnicas de cultivo, preparación de tierra, la forma correcta de cómo aplicar los diferentes insumos que ayudan al desarrollo y crecimiento del producto, etc. El terreno que ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo le pertenece al ya que fue heredado por medio de sus padres el cual está a cinco minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente en el cual se involucra la familia. El grano al final de la cosecha lo vende en la comunidad a compradores locales e intermediarios.
Doña Elia como meta tiene propuesto comprar más tierra para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y poderles brindar lo necesario para que sigan estudiando y sean personas de bien. Por lo que hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual dará una mejor asistencia y un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que la temporada se aproxima y quiere sacar una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Elia is 45 years old. She is married and has 5 children who attend a school in her community. Elia had no opportunity to study due to a lack of financial support from her parents as their economic situation was not very good at the time. 

Elia has been growing coffee for the past 6 years. She learned how through an institution which trains farmers. They are shown the best methods of growing, preparing the land, how to safely apply the products that are applied to protect and promote the growth of the crops, etc. The land that she works on. along with her husband. is hers, an inheritance from her parents. It is a 5 minute walk away from her house, which they walk every day to work the fields. She sells the beans at harvest time to local buyers and intermediaries in her community.
