Elia's goal is to buy more land so that her children have a better future. She wants to be able to offer them everything necessary so they can continue to study and grow up to be good citizens. To this end Elia is requesting a loan so she can help protect and maintain her coffee crops as the season is approaching and she wants to produce an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 25-year-old, married father of one child. He works in the transportation business, which he has done since one year ago. He is a hard worker, specialized in providing transportation services for his fellow villagers, to and from nearby villages. This is his only source for living, since his wife doesn't work. That is why he puts so much effort into developing his business, to provide his family a better living.

Nour is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to refinance the remaining amount he owes for the price of his bus, which he uses for his transporting business. His income is fine, but he will need to improve it in the future, to make sure that it will provide his family with a very good income.

loans.use: to refinance the remaining amount he owes for the price of his bus, which he uses for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married to a carpenter and has three children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Evelyn currently sells vegetables in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). With over five years of experience in this trade, Evelyn sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase the quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more vegetables, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Evelyn wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her vegetable enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, helping her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Yana

texts.es:
Yana tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en Oyotún, su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivos de arroz y algodón, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 10 años atrás Yana junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, gallinas, cerdos, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para compra animales pequeños y ofrecerlos en las zonas aledañas a su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yana, age 36, lives with her husband and their children in Oyotún.  The inhabitants sell small animals and grow rice and cotton.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Yana, together with her family, has been raising and selling small animals like ducks, chickens, and pigs, for ten years.

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to buy small animals and to sell them in the areas outlying her community.  This way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Zaña, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivos de caña de azúcar, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una mototaxi y se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Zaña. Cayaltí y viceversa, David ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de su unidad vehicular, compra de carpa y un repuesto y de esta manera seguir percibiendo ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
David, age 38, lives with his wife in the Zaña district.  The inhabitants there sell small animals and grow sugarcane.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  It is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has a ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle], and he provides public transportation service.  He covers the Zaña-Cayaltí route and vice versa.

David has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to fix his vehicle, to buy a canopy, and to buy a replacement part.  This way he will continue getting income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a canopy and a replacement part for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, ha ampliado en gran medida su taller mecánico, y necesita incluir en su inventario herramientas que son necesarias para realizar un buen trabajo a sus clientes. Comprara herramientas (desarmadores, llaves, gato hidráulico y otros), con el préstamo anterior el invirtió en su negocio con ello lo amplio, tuvo mejores ingresos y mantuvo la fidelidad de sus clientes.
Su economía ha mejorado mantiene su grupo familiar, les da una mejor alimentación y salud. Ellos lo siguen apoyando en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Jesus has expanded his mechanics workshop a lot, and he needs to include in his inventory tools that he needs to do good work for his customers.  

With this loan, he will buy tools (screwdrivers, wrenches, hydraulic jack, and other tools).  He invested his previous loan in his business.  It enabled him to expand the business, increase his income, and maintain his customers' loyalties.

His finances have improved; he supports his household, and he's been able to give them better food and health.  He will continue to support them with his projects.

loans.use: to buy tools (screwdrivers, wrenches, a hydraulic jack, and other items).

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 52 and is a widower with three children. He lives in the village of Ozamiz City in Misamis Occidental where he serves the community with his transportation business. He carries passengers and baggage to earn a living. He joined GDMPC recently after a friend invited him to join. He borrowed a loan to buy new tires for the motorcycle used in his business. With this business, he was able to support his family's daily living. In the future, he wants to have better transportation services so that he could earn more for a comfortable and improved living.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the motorcycle used in his business.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella is a widow and has three children who already have their own families. To earn a living, Bella has run a printing press business in her community for more than ten years. She always finds ways to please the needs of her customers. With her determination in improving the business, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair the existing printing machine to provide better services. She wants to expand her business in the future and let her children manage it in the near future.

loans.use: to repair the existing printing machine to provide better services.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El señor  Rene,  vive en la comunidad de Mizque, tiene tres hijos dependientes, don  Rene se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, actualmente trabaja en unas pequeñas parcelas que su padre le dejo. Recientemente la tristeza que paso toda su familia fue que  en la anterior cosecha hubo  desastre natural de helada  y sus cultivos bajaron de rendimiento, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que  a su familia mantiene  con la producción agrícola donde su producción solo son temporales por causa de que no tiene sistema de riego. 
Rene es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicado a sus preciosos pequeños hijos y su trabajo, pese que el sufre de una enfermedad y que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura en otras zonas para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a toda su familia, el  está solicitando el crédito para comprar semilla de papa,  y abono orgánico y de esta forma mejorara la calidad y el rendimiento de sus cultivos, que trabajara en su pequeña parcela que tiene en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingreso económicos  y  darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que ellos  puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Rene lives in the Mizque community and has three dependent children.  Rene is a farmer and currently works some small parcels of land that his father left him.  His family recently faced a sad event with their last harvest.  There was a natural disaster, a frost, and his crops were not very productive.  This disaster made his income farm income fail.  He does not have an irrigation system, so his production is seasonal

Rene is a very liked and respected person in his community, because of his dedication to his lovey young children and to his work.  All this, despite being sick, at times he must work shifts on other farms in order to support his family.  He is asking for a loan so that he can buy potato seeds and compost so he can improve his production and income, provide a better quality of life for his children, and allow them to go to school under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy seed and compost.

loans.name: Shushana

texts.en:
Shushana, age 41, is from the Akhaltsikhe district, where she lives with her son and daughter. Shushana is divorced. The only person who earns money in the household is her son, who is a soldier and serves in the army. Shushana would like to start up a clothing sales business in her community, in order to earn an additional income. She has applied for this loan, in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices with which to start her business.

Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Shushana is confident that her endeavor will meet a high demand. She intends to develop positive relationships with her customers and expects to attain a good profit from her new business. This start-up loan offers Shushana a good chance to earn a more stable income and improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, for resale and the start-up of a new business

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Analie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice-vending business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 53 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos en Pucará una zona con clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, café y cacao, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedican a la cría y comercio de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas, pavos, patos, en el puerto de Chiple, Sembastiana ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles, para invertir comprando animales pequeños y posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mayor precio, generándole así ingresos que puedan darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
53-year old Sebastiana lives with her two children in the warm climate of the community of Pucará, about two hours from the town of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of Peru's north coast. The local people grow fruit, coffee, and cocoa. 

With help from her children Sebastiana raises and sells pigs, chickens, turkeys and ducks in Chiple. She is seeking a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy young animals, fatten them, and then sell them for a good price. She will earn income to  provide her with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy piglets and baby turkeys

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 28 years old and she is married and has four children. She is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $70. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drink (beer), cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milks, and biscuits. 

She is a very hard working woman and doing business has been her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beer, cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milks and biscuits

loans.name: David Ezequiel

texts.es:
David de 46 años, es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo, es maestro de música religiosa. Actualmente, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de edades entre 10 y 18 años, los 3 se encuentran estudiando.
David tiene muchos años de experiencia en la rama de la música religiosa y aparte de ser maestro, también es escritor ya que elabora manuales de música cristiana, para comercializarlos en las iglesias y otros lugares donde los necesitan. 
El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo,  es para comprar material, para la elaboración de más manuales de música, ya que es una buena inversión y además expresó que tiene mucho éxito al vender los manuales, y con la ayuda proporcionada, el cliente tendrá muchos más ingresos y así podrá darles una mejor educación y alimentación a sus hijos.
David tiene como propósito, abrir su propia escuela de música, ya que dice que hay mucha demanda de este servicio y lo piensa aprovechar.
texts.en:
David is 46 years old. He is very dedicated to his work. He is a religious music teacher. He lives with his wife and 3 children who are between the ages of 10 and 18. All 3 are studying. 

David has many years experience in the religious music field, other than being a teacher. He is also a writer as he produces Christian music manuals to sell to churches and other places that need them.

The loan that David is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy material to make more music manuals. It is a good investment and he also adds that he has had a lot of success selling the manuals. With the help of the loan he will have much higher revenues and will be able to offer better education and food to his children. David has the intention of opening a Music academy as there is much demand for this service and he is thinking of taking advantage of it.

loans.use: to buy material to make more music manuals.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married and has three children. She received some schooling, through the end of junior high. Currently, Comfort sells diapers in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this business for about five years now. Her husband is a construction worker. Comfort’s income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. She will use this loan to increase her existing diaper inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing diaper inventory

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. She received some schooling until the end of junior high school.

Currently Veronica sells vegetables in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. Her husband is a construction worker. Veronica’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Veronica will use the loan to increase her existing vegetable capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Veronica plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing vegetable capacity

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 39 years old and married. She has managed her farm for more than fifteen years to make a living. She used to harvest coconut and vegetables from the farm and sell the farm products in town. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. Her future plan is to replant coconut on the farm and grow bananas as another crop to gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, de 51 años, es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Julia, con quien tiene 6 hijos, a los que sacan adelante en la casa que compraron hace 20 años. Su esposa desde las primeras horas del día, se dirige a sus sembríos pues ya no trabajan juntos, ambos se ayudaban constantemente. Cuenta que hace poco, comenzó a trabajar en una empresa constructora de carreteras, donde recibe un sueldo mensual que ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Por eso su esposa tomó las riendas de la agricultura. Cuida mucho de sus sembríos de maíz, papa y demás hortalizas. Además de las vacas que siempre le otorgan muchos litros de leche, las cuales comercializa a los productores de queso que la visitan todas las tardes. Ahora, Gerardo, espera poder aumentar su ganado, ya que recibe ganancias diarias de sus animales, “la agricultura, es por temporadas”, afirma, asimismo comenta que en sus tiempos libres y los fines de semana, apoya en los trabajos de campo. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Gerardo, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Gerardo, age 51, is a hard-working man.  He lives with his wife, Julia, with whom he has six children.  They get their children ahead in the house that they bought 20 years ago.  His wife, starting in the first hours of the day, heads out for their crops.  They no longer work together; they used to help each other all of the time.

He says that a little while ago he started to work for a road construction company where he gets a monthly salary that helps with the household expenses.  Therefore, his wife took the reins of the agriculture.  She takes great care of the corn, potato, and other vegetable crops.  This is in addition to the cows that always give them liters of milk, which they sell to the cheese producers who come to see her every afternoon.

Gerardo now wishes to be able to increase his livestock because he gets daily earnings from his animals.  “Farming is seasonal,” he states.  He comments that in his free time and on the week-ends he helps with the field work.

This is his second loan with Kiva.  He is happy.  He has the money needed to improve his business, and, in turn, his quality of life.  Also, he likes belonging to his association because the members are collaborative and hard-working people.  Gerardo will use the 800 soles to buy organic fertilizer to spread among his plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell  for her fish vending business.

Analyn has been in this business for ten years. Analyn earns more income from pig fattening.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Segundo Orestes

texts.es:
Orestes tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el Distrito de Pucará, con un clima caluroso, su población se dedica al comercio de frutales, arroz, café y otros, también comercializan ganado vacuno, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El realiza la venta de celulares, cargadores, memorias, usb, recargas, así como también cuenta con un estudio fotográfico, adicionalmente brinda servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, Orestes ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles en la compra de papel fotográfico y una impresora que le permita desarrollar sus fotos, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Orestes is 53 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the Pucara district.  This is a place with a warm climate, where the residents work selling fruits, rice, coffee, and other products, and they also sell dairy cows.  It's located 2 hours from the city of Jaen, and is in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Orestes has a business selling cellular phones, chargers, memory cards, usb connectors, and cellular minutes.  He also has a photographic studio, and he works providing transportation services in his moto-taxi.  Orestes has requested a loan of 500 Peruvian soles to buy photographic paper and a printer that will allow him to develop his photos.  This will enable him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy photographic paper and a printer

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos, en el distrito de Oyotun donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y y cultivo de arroz, algodón y yuca, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, tambien tiene una vaca que su produccion vende a sus clientes que a la vez son sus vecinos, Epifania ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para su vaca permitiendole tener mayor producción que le generará mayores utilidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Epifania is 55 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Oyotun district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region. The people here raise small animals and grow rice, cotton and yucca.

Epifania raises and sells small animals. She also has a cow whose product she sells to clients who are also her neighbors. Epifania is requesting a loan of 500 PEN to buy balanced feed for her cow. This will allow for maximum production which will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is a young Cameroonian aged 28 and is married with three children. The oldest is six and in primary school while the youngest is still breast feeding.

She has been in this business for the past three years which makes her very experienced and her business profitable. She is likely to succeed because her business is located in an urban center with many potential customers. This loan will increase her turn over by 20 percent. Her standard of living will also be improved.

loans.use: to buy stock (rice, beans, maggi, sugar, savon, tinned tomatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a widow and has four children. Having successfully graduated from fourth grade, Elizabeth is now an established businesswoman. She sells diapers in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for her entire family. Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase increased stocks of diapers, thus enabling her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to customers' changing preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased stocks of diapers

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana operates a fabric-selling business in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She is a single mother with eleven children. As the sole breadwinner, Diana uses her income to provide for her entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, she understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fabric

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.

Currently, Comfort sells charcoal and firewood in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Comfort is married to a carpenter and has four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. Comfort has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Ghanaian artist who combines painting and collage techniques in mixed media art that depicts West African culture. He would like to stock up on calico, batik fabrics and other materials to create new works.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I honed my artistic skills in Nigeria. I worked with a company that exported African arts and crafts. We toured the whole of Nigeria buying goods. It was on one of these tours that I came across this type of artwork and fell in love with it. I modified it and in the process created something new and unique. I decided to come back home to continue with this new-found talent. I derive my motifs from social, cultural and historic events."

"I am always grateful for your help and, with the last loan I received, I have been able to increase my stock. I thank all the people who have so generously helped me."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's framed batik art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/649

loans.use: to stock up on calico, batik fabrics and other materials to create new works

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood, his raw material, to increase production.

Winfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"I developed the art of carving at a young age. After school, I'd walk to a nearby workshop to observe carvers busy sculpting different objects from a log of wood. I was surprised to see such beautiful art pieces, and this aroused my interest in learning more. Several times during such visits, I picked up pieces of wood from the workshop and, when I reached home, I tried my hand at carving, following the process I had observed."

"The assistance I am receiving from you through this microcredit helps me so much. I thank you for helping me to grow my business."

Use the link below to view Winfred's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8014

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, his raw material, to increase production

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years old and married with four children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Emily has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs, rice retailing, and selling pre-paid mobile loads.

Emily aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is offered to Prisca to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy a stock of items to keep in her store like water, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes, noodles and rice. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in this business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Efipania

texts.en:
Efipania is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Efipania is 52 years old and has three children who are in school.

Efipania has a hollow blocks manufacturing business in the Philippines. Efipania requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase cement, sand, gravels and other materials.

Efipania has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Efipania would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel and other materials.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda works hard to support her family. Gerarda is a widow who has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for fifteen years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy cloth, thread, and other materials.

In the future, Gerarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she received no formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling vegetables in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Elizabeth is married and has six children. Her husband works as a construction worker. The proceeds from Elizabeth's business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of vegetables. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits in her business, thus helping her expand to meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Grupo La Fe Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Grupo la Fe está conformado por once integrantes, madres soleteras con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres les gustas disfrutar  de tiempo con sus pequeños hijos, les preparan platos típicos como “Indio Viejo”  estas mujeres desde muy joven se vieron obligadas a trabajar, por falta de recursos económicos, por lo tanto luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Que puedan estudiar y ser mujeres y hombres de bien.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es  Emilia y tiene por actividad económica la venta de golosinas como caramelos, meneítos, churritos, paletas, bombones, chicles, gomitas, galletas, chocolates. Actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulantes con una canasta sobres su cabeza de uno 20 kg. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto  ya que es el sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su canasta de golosinas para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Grupo la Fe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Grupo la Fe" is made up of 11 members.  They are single mothers with 15 children in their care. They are natives of Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern part of the country.  These women are known for being hardworking and responsible, and for having a desire for personal success.  In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their small children, and preparing traditional dishes such as "Indio Viejo" (a corn-based stew).  These women had to work from a young age due to a lack of financial resources.  They struggle each day to provide their children with a better future, so that they can get an education and become good men and women.  These women are working hard because they have a strong desire to get ahead.

Emilia is the coordinator of the group.  She has a business selling snacks such as: caramels, cheese puffs, chips, popsicles, bon bons, gum drops, cookies, and chocolates.  She sells her products on the street from a 20 kilogram (44 pound) basket that she carries on her head.  She performs this work with pleasure, because this is how she supports her children.  Her goal with this loan is to invest in working capital, stocking her basket with snacks so that she will be able to obtain more earnings in the near future.  

The communal bank "Grupo la Fe" thanks the Kiva lenders for the help that they are giving to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that in the near future they can increase their incomes.

loans.use: to stock her business with snacks

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 51 years old and married with three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where he manages a farm as a tenant on the side. He plants corn and harvests coconuts to sell in town. He has been doing this for more than fifteen years aside from offering his transportation services. He joined GDMPC in 2010 and the previous loan from GDMPC that was used in his transportation services business was successfully repaid. Recently, he requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure in order to improve his farm. His hopes and dreams are to have a better future and an improved farm to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en la  zona del  distrito de  Nueva   Arica – Sector la Viña, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.
Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y ofrecerlos a un precio más alto, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 67 years old. She lives with her family in the la Viña sector of  Nueva Arica, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's North Coast. The people here are involved in business, farm and raise livestock. 

Juana raises and sells small animals. She has requested a loan of 1200 PEN to buy balanced feed. In this way she can achieve better production and offer lower prices, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.

She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, fish, milks, coffee, sugar, cigarettes and salt.  She has been involving herself in business activities since 2007. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

She is happy with this loan because they are offered to poor people and will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, fish, milks, coffee, sugar, cigarettes and salt

loans.name: Vertila

texts.en:
Vertila is 37 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Vertila works very hard to provide for them.

Vertila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice, shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, canned goods, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Vertila has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, canned goods, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Vertila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, shampoo, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, canned goods, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Trinidad requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment and gears for fishing. She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and gears for fishing.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with two children and helps her husband to earn a living. She has been selling snacks in their community as an aid to her husband's income from working as carpenter. 

She joined GDMPC in 2012 and she gained access to micro-finance aside from other services. She borrowed a loan to buy raw ingredients to cook and sell snacks in town. 

Fe dreams to have her own food stall in the market, where she can sell more food and be able to earn additional income for the family. In the future, she wants to renovate their house to have better living conditions with the family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook

loans.name: Brendalyn

texts.en: Brendalyn is 39 years of age and single. She manages a small store business in her village and sells a variety of grocery items, like noodles, shampoo and soap, to her costumers. According to her, 30% of her income is being used for household expenses, while the remaining 70% is used as revolving capital to run the business. Brendalyn dreams of having a one-stop shop store someday.  That’s why she is managing her business well-- to make her dream come true. To facilitate this, Brendalyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy beverages, eggs, canned goods, and other items. She's hoping that her business will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy beverages, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is 54 years old and lives in Locuban, Dumalinao.  She is married and has four children.
Sauda has a shop that sells dry goods.  She has had this business for four years.  She's requested a loan for 14,000 PHP so that she'll have capital for her sari-sari. Sauda has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Sauda hopes to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to run her sari-sari.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP [Philippine pesos] loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, spices, eggs, shampoo, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, spices, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a bar and restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Gina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of beer, canned goods, vegetables, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of beer, canned goods, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen, 32 years old, is a married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ailen has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Ailen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and has four children. She lives in Guba, Clarin, the Philippines, along with her family. 

Marilyn has managed a general store for 15 years to supplement her husband's income. Aside from this, she also cooks food and serves it in her cafeteria, which is next to her store. Her earnings are good enough that she was able to send her children to school. 

Marilyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. Her previous loan was used in her store and has been successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan recently to purchase raw ingredients for her cafeteria. She dreams of having a better life with the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her cafeteria

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Aileen is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
This is Leilani, 43, and resident of Batasan, Quezon City in the Philippines. She is married to Nelson and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Leilani operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers uniforms, jogging pants, sportswear and shirts. Seasonal clothing like uniforms and such are available all-year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Leilani hopes that her business will grow larger and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ivonia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Ivonia to improve her business. She is married, and she has two children. The second child is the only one in school.

Ivonia has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as women's clothes and kids clothes and underwear for pregnant women. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Ivonia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes, kids clothes and underwear for pregnant women.

loans.name: John Larry

texts.en:
John is a retired US Army officer whose own experiences with massage as a remedy for aches and pains inspired him to open a Zen Massage Franchising location in North Charleston, SC.

John says, “I believe in the therapeutic value of massage. Being a retired US Army officer, I have had my share of aches and pains, and massage therapy has been a wonderful alternative to medication and physical therapy. I wanted to be able to share this benefit with others at a reasonable cost with no associated membership fees or club dues.”

John’s dedication to working hard (his location is open seven days a week) and helping others has certainly paid off. After only one year of operation, his massage therapy center became the second most productive in the Zen Massage Franchise, and now – after two-and-a-half years in operation – they are tied for first place.

Help John purchase new equipment and expand the line of esthetic products available to his clients.

Check out John’s business: http://zenmassagecharleston.com

loans.use: to pay for equipment and inventory purchases for his massage therapy center.

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.es: Ambrocio, tiene 22 años de edad, oriundo de Aiquile, una persona muy humilde, amable trabajador, no tiene hijos, hace poco tiempo atrás vivia con una pareja pero por discusiones se separaron temporalmente. El ya radica cuatro años en la comunidad de Chimore, trabaja en el rubro del transporte, esta afiliado a un sindicato de moto taxistas, perteneciente a la misma comunidad donde trabaja todo el dia e incluso tambien en las noches. Su herramienta de trabajo que es la motocicleta ya presenta algunos desperfectos por lo que no puede ofrecer un servicio eficiente, es por lo que ahora el solicita el credito, para vender la que tiene y comprarse una nueva, y de esa manera tener mejores ingresos por la calida de servicio que puede llegar a ofrecer y asi tambien tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ambrocio is 22 years old and from Aiquile. He’s a humble and likable working man. He doesn’t have kids. A little while ago, he was living with a girlfriend, but they decided to split up temporarily. He’s been living in the town of Chimore for several years. He works in the transportation business, and he’s joined a group of moto-taxi drivers in the same neighborhood where he works all day and also at night. His motorcycle is his means of work, but it has some problems and doesn’t work efficiently which is why he’s asking for a loan to sell the one he has and buy a new one. This way he his income will increase due to the improvement in the quality of service that he offers, and he will also have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Sandra  Irene

texts.es:
Sandra es una señora de25 años. Vive en el recinto San Gabriel cerca a Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, sitio turístico por sus balnearios, ríos paisajes con gente amable y sencilla este rincón del Ecuador tiene un clima cálido – húmedo, además que es el punto de encuentro entre las regiones costa y sierra. 
Sandra desde muy joven formó su hogar debido a que dejó su casa a temprana edad;  porque su padre la maltrataba mucho, ahora  tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y una nena de un año de edad, sus dos hijos mayores estudian la escuela en un recinto cerca a su casa.
 Sandra  es una señora muy trabajadora, se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace cinco años para mantener a su familia, se dedica todos los días a la semana a al cuidado y la comercialización de los cerdos lo hace en las ferias e invierte al menos 4 horas en esta actividad ya que también requiere de tiempo para el cuidado de sus hijos. 
Ahora cuenta con 20 chanchos los cuales demanda gastos para la alimentación, por ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa ya que la refirió una tía quien ya lleva trabajando varios años con la institución, Fundación Alternativa le abrió las puertas a través de este crédito, con esto invertirá en la compra de balanceado y cerdos  con lo cual espera incrementar sus ganancias que le ayudarán a mejorar parte de su vivienda ya que en su casa aún le falta muchos acabados y así llevar un mejor estilo de vida. Agradece de todo corazón a la institución por la ayuda brindada y a Kiva por la confianza depositada en ella.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old. She lives in the San Gabriel precinct close to Santo Domingo do los Tsachila. This is a tourist area with spas, river landscapes, and friendly and simple people. This part of Ecuador has a warm and wet climate, and it’s where the mountains and the coast meet. 

When she was very young, Sandra left home and lived on her own because her father was very abusive. Now she has an 8 year old, a 6 year old, and a one year old infant. Her oldest two kids go to school at a campus close to her home. 

Sandra is a very hardworking woman. She’s been raised pigs for 5 years to support her family. She works every day of the week raising and selling the pigs at market. She works at least 4 hours a day doing this since she needs time to care for her children. 

Right now she has 20 pigs and expenses for their feed. For that reason she went to Fundación Alternativa since she had been referred by an aunt who has worked with them for several years. Fundación Alternativa opened their doors to provide this loan. She invested in the purchase of feed and pigs with which she hopes to increase her profits. The profits will go towards improving a part of her home, since it remains unfinished, and improving her quality of life. She thanks the lending agency with all her heart for the help she’s gotten, and she thanks Kiva for the trust they’ve had in her.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 56 años de edad, vive en una zona donde netamente se dedican a la cría y producción lechera, vive actualmente con su esposa y una hija que le ayuda en la elaboración de los quesillos que diariamente entregan a la venta a las señoras de su zona que son rescatistas y revenden todo lo que recolectan de la zona,  en un mercado popular de la ciudad. Necesita capital de operación para comprar forraje  (cáscara de soya), que en la época que ha pasado es muy cotizada, para su ganado y es alimento esencial todo el año.  Él trabaja como mano de obra de albañil en diferentes obras de construcción de viviendas en toda la ciudad, ahora está trabajando es su barrio en la construcción de una vivienda.  Quieren crecer un poco en su actividad lechera y se están esforzando para mejorar su vivienda y así sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is 56 years old. He lives in an area focused on the raising of cattle and milk production. He lives with his wife and a daughter who helps make cheese products that they deliver every day to local women who gather up the products and resell them at a popular market in town. 

He needs working capital to buy soy husks which are highly sought after as livestock feed throughout the year. 

He works as a mason in the construction of different homes throughout the city. Right now he’s working on the construction of a home in his neighborhood. He wants to expand his dairy business, and he’s working on improving his home and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soy husks.

loans.name: Anapati

texts.en: Living near a main road, Anapati operates a business from her home selling plates, spoons and glasses. She opened her kiosk a year ago with working capital of $600.00 and is earning a good income. Anapati has requested a loan of $1,000.00 to buy more stocks to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons and glasses

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Consolacion works hard to support her family. She has a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming root crops. Consolacion is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 4 hijos, pero solo educa a 2 de ellos en una casa alquilada. Sus hijos aún son pequeños, por eso tiene que incrementar sus fuerzas al doble para poder sacarlos adelante. Mientras que su esposo se dedica al noble oficio de albañil, ella comienza el día con la preparación de exquisita comida de casa, pero como es una señora trabajadora se dedica tambien a la venta de ropa variada a los pobladores de su localidad, quienes se siente agradecida con ella, pues deja al crédito algunas prendas, para pagar después. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias para poder poner una tienda de venta de ropa, estable y así no tener que vender como ambulante de casa en casa.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Olimpia; invertirá los S/2500 soles en la compra de ropa variada y al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 48 years old, is a hard working woman who lives in a rented home with her 4 children (only two of them are studying). Her children are still very young, and for this reason she needs to double her efforts to be able to offer the best to them, so that they can get ahead in life. 

While her husband works in construction, as a mason, she begins the day by preparing delicious dishes for her family, but since she is a very hardworking person, she also sells clothing to the residents in her community. Her customers are grateful to her because she offers the possibility of buying on credit, accepting payments later on. Now, Olimpia wishes to increase her income in order to open a clothing store, and stop selling door-to-door. 

This is Olimpia’s first Kiva loan, and she feels very happy because with enough money she will improve her business and as a result her quality of life.
Olimpia will invest the loan of S/2500 soles to buy wholesale clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing for her business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima, 54, is married with two children. She runs a general store to make a living. She has been in this business for more than four years as an aid to her husband's income from employment as a family driver. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and, recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional grocery goods for sale. She hopes to sustain the business and improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
This is Marietha. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marietha would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marietha hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory.

loans.name: Brigitte's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Brigitte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Brigitte est âgée de 40 ans et n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Brigitte est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Brigitte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Pour  subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Brigitte mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois et de chaussures de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Brigitte désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Brigitte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people living in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Brigitte, is the lady with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time the group is applying for financial aide from Alidé. This is being done with the aim of furthering their business. Brigitte is 40 years old and never went to school. Brigitte is married to man called Jean, with whom she has had three children, some of which which are receiving an education. They also have another child living under their care. In other to provide for herself and her children, Brigitte manages a travelling charcoal and shoe sale business. In order to further her business and better meet her clients' demands, Brigitte wishes to increase her stock of products. In order to do so, Brigitte is requesting, along with the other members of her group, her first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy shoes and charcoal.

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita is 68 years old and widowed with six children.

Anacita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Anacita has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for ten years and also earns income from buying and selling bananas.

Anacita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling young coconuts. Julieta is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to acheive her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: In six years of managing a sari-sari store business, Rosemarie learned new strategies for how she can improve her business. Through her earnings, she provides for some of her children's needs in school. Rosemarie wanted to expand the products she sells by offering meat, fish, and chicken to her customers. In connection, she is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy grocery items to sell, like canned goods, bread, milk, and beverages. Rosemarie believes that by expanding the products she sells, she will earn more income from the business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, and beverages.

loans.name: Ronelita

texts.en:
Ronelita is 57 years old and married with eight children.

Ronelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ronelita has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business of buying and selling charcoal for five years and also earns income from selling bananas.

Ronelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items for resale, such as shampoo, eggs, coffee, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc., for her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items for resale, such as shampoo, eggs, coffee, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 54 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cleofe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Cleofe has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cleofe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married to a teacher. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

Despite her lack of formal education, Beatrice currently sells bed sheets in Mpatado (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience in this trade, Beatrice sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more bed sheets and boost her overall sales. 

Beatrice wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets and boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is a single entrepreneur who runs a cosmetics business to earn a living. After finishing her studies, Jonna sells cosmetics products, starting with her friends and then with her community. 

She joined GDMPC and borrowed money to buy more cosmetics products to resell.  She plans to repair the family house using her generated revenue to live comfortably with her parents.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products to resell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 38 years old and married. She has three children who are in school.

Rosita has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 5 times in the past to sustain her business.

Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has business making fermented fish and shrimp in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from fishing. Rowena is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase fish and shrimp for her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Christina works very hard to provide for them.

Christina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Christina has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, bread, noodles, candies, snack foods, etc. 

Christina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 56 years old and married with four children.

Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items for resale, such as cups of noodles, coffee, milk, etc.

Angeles has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Angeles aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, such as cups of noodles, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Bevencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bevencia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and also earns additional income from making mats. Bevencia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

Bevencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham, Phal is 24 years old, married, and has a small child, who completely stays in her care. 

Phal and her husband are farmers, working on their own farm in Rantanakiri, where they grow cassavas to sell. They are able to make a net income of USD 5 each per day. She also works as a paid laborer to earn additional income. Besides her hardships, Phal aims to save enough money for the future education of her child.

As it is her third loan cycle, Phal would like to buy a motorcycle to help her in her transportation needs. Then she will have two motorcycles in the household, which will allow her and her husband to commute to their working areas individually. 

In the future, she plans to enlarge her farming areas in Ratanakiri to improve her productivity. She thanks lenders for their generosities towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her in her transportation needs.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo, a 63-year-old resident of Silanga, Tangub City, provides for his four children's needs from the little amount he gains monthly from his own piggery business. He has been running this business for more than two years as aid to his wife's income from her employment. In 2010, Rodrigo became a member of GDMPC and previous loans taken that were used for feeding supplies were successfully repaid. Recently, Rodrigo borrowed a new loan to use it for the renovation of his piggery. He wants to expand to his business in the future.

loans.use: to renovate his piggery.

loans.name: Ma. Lucena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Lucena, 44, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Lucena offers manicures and pedicures. She already has regular customers in her community, and they just contact her when they need her. She does in-home service as well. She also sells frozen and processed foods for additional income. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters, and other materials needed in her business. 

Ma. Lucena dreams that her business will flourish even more and hopes to give her family a good future. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters and other materials

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: Melody, married with an only child, is earning in her buy and sell business, selling cosmetic products as an aid to her husband's income from working as a driver. She joined GDMPC, and recently borrowed a loan to buy additional cosmetic products to resell. She wants to purchase a motorcycle to use it in her business. Melody wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 47 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Guillerma runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 17 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of merchandise to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, and eggs.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is married, and she works hard to support her family. She has had a ceramics-making business in the Philippines for the past seven years.

Annalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement and paint.

In the future, Annalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement and paint

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is a 59-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alejandrina has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Alejandrina has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Alejandrina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell in her business.

Susana has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from a general store business and from buying and selling charcoal.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn Ruffa

texts.en:
Jenelyn Ruffa is 22 years old, single, and works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Jenelyn Ruffa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Jenelyn Ruffa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen products to sell for her business.

Sarah has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen products to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling vegetables. Marissa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell.

Marissa has sustained her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Milagro de Dios está conformado nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por ser zona productora de leche, queso, cuajada. Estas personas se caracterizan por trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar una carrera universitaria por la misma pobreza en la que se vive en la zonas rurales, por lo tanto luchan  dio  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, ya que eso significa para ellos que todos los días tiene que pasar un gran riesgo al cruzarse el rio ya que es la única forma de comunicarse en las zona rurales.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Priscila y tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación ella todos los días carga con un peso de unos 20 kg  para vender el pan como cachos, semitas, tortas de piña, pasteles, empandas, pan simple. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de pan, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El banco comunal Milagro de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Milagro de Dios [Miracle of God] communal bank is made up of nine members: eight women and a man.  They are responsible mothers and fathers with fifteen children under their care.  They are from Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country.  Sauce is known for being a region that produces milk, cheese, and curds.  These people are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement.  Unfortunately, they couldn’t study for a university degree due to the poverty that they live with in rural zones.  Because of this, from day to day they fight to give their children a better future. That means that every day they have to put themselves at great risk to cross the river, because it is the only way to get around in the rural areas.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Priscila. She works as a mobile bread vendor, also selling it from her home.  Everyday she carries about 20 kilograms to sell--items such as crescent rolls, sweet pastries, pineapple cakes, cakes, empanadas, and basic bread.  She works in her business some eight hours daily.  The goal of her loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business in the buying and selling of bread, so that in the not-so-distant future she can earn a better income.  The Milagro de Dios communal bank expresses their thanks that Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a respectable job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock items to sell such as crescent rolls, pastries, pineapple cakes, cakes, empanadas, and basic bread.

loans.name: Anna Rizza

texts.en:
Anna Rizza is 24 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale, to earn a living. Aside from this, she also sells snacks in school as an aid to their income from farming. 

Her previous loan taken from GDMPC was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook snacks for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook snacks for sale.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is married and she works hard to support her family. She has had an egg vending business in the Philippines for the past four years.

Celerina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

In the future, Celerina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 60-year-old married woman with one child who attends school. 

Epifania is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a rice vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell.
