Epifania has been in this business for five years. In the future, Epifania would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia works hard to support her family. She is married and she has an egg vending business in the Philippines.

Celia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers. Celia has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Celia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 33, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Francisca has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, etc. for her business.

Francisca has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 23 years old and married with two children.

Riza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Riza has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal for 2 years, and earns an income from buy-and-sell bananas.

Riza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell in her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anna Evangeline

texts.en:
Anna Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell in her coconut wine vending business.

Anna Evangeline has been in this business for 5 years. Anna Evangeline earns more income from farming rice.

Anna Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Patora

texts.en:
Pastora is 63 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, along with her three children. Pastora has operated her own retail business for more than 11 years to earn a living. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and her previous loans that were used in the business were successfully repaid. 

Pastora is requesting a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods in addition to her inventory working capital in order to expand her product offering. In the future, Pastora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is running a retail store to provide the needs of her only child. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. She had joined GDMPC last year, and now, Janice borrowed a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She is hopeful to sustain her business and be able to send her child to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Reneboy

texts.en:
Reneboy is 32 years old and married with one child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where he operates his service-based business, carrying passengers and baggage to earn a living.

Reneboy joined GDMPC in 2010, and his previous loan taken to repair the vehicle was successfully repaid. He borrowed a new loan to buy new tires for his motor . He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 55 years old and married with four children.

Isabelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, such as soaps, shampoos, toothbrushes, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

Isabelita has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years, and earns an income from farming rice.

Isabelita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as soaps, shampoos, toothbrushes, milk, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, such as chips, bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Baby Jane has been in this business for 3 years and earns more income from raising pigs.

Baby Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, such as chips, bread, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Isaerma

texts.es:
Isaerma es una mujer de 40 años de edad agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en la primaria en una escuela de la comunidad y los otros 2 no tiene la edad para asistir. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta cursando solo el primer grado únicamente ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos necesarios para apoyarla y decidieron enseñándole a trabajar la agricultora a muy temprana edad y hoy en día sigue trabajando en compañía de su esposo. La tierra que junto a su esposo trabaja es propia gracias a una compra que hizo la cual está ubicada a una hora de camino desde su casa de habitación. Uno de sus más grandes desafíos es el incremento de precios en los insumos que utiliza para la asistencia de sus cultivos de café ya que son productos necesarios para la protección debida ya que la competencia no es problema.
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL que permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas, como: 4 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 4 QQ de urea, 10 QQ de gallinaza, 1 Lt. de Daconil, 1 Lt. de Escore con lo que podrá asistir sus cultivos de café y la compra de 1350 nuevas plantas de café las cuales podrá cultivar y preparar para la próxima temporada.
Su mayor anhelo y más grande sueño es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad para que en el futuro puedan valerse por sí mismos ya que con lo que ellos ganan no les alcanza para dejarles un patrimonio digno y puedan enfrentar de manera favorable los problemas económicos y a corto plazo poder arreglar su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Isaerma is a 40 year-old woman who is a housewife and a farmer.  She is the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are studying in a local elementary school, and 2 of whom are not yet school-aged.  Isaerma has only a first grade education, because her parents did not have the financial resources needed to support her education.  They taught her to farm at an early age, and today she continues doing this work alongside her husband.  

The land that she works with her husband is their own, thanks to a purchase that they made.  Their fields are located an hour away from their home.  One of their biggest challenges is the increase in prices of supplies that they use to tend to their crops, because they need these products to protect their crops.  The competition is not a problem for them.

Isaerma has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative that will enable her to acquire agricultural supplies such as: 400 pounds of 12-24-12 (Nitrogen-Phosphorus-Potassium in %) fertilizer, 400 pounds of urea, 1,000 pounds of poultry manure, 1 liter of Daconil (fungicide), and 1 liter of Escore, to use in tending to her coffee plants.  She will also purchase 1,350 new coffee plants to cultivate and prepare for the next season.

Isaerma's biggest desire and dream is to be able to see her children graduate from the university so that in the future they can support themselves, because her earnings will not be sufficient to leave them a decent inheritance.  With an education, they will be able to face any financial difficulties in a favorable manner.  In the short run, she also dreams of being able to make some repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and new coffee seedlings to cultivate

loans.name: Evelina

texts.ru:
Эвелина – из Виноградово. Она – замужем, у нее двое сыновей. Эвелина работает на частном предприятии «Профдезинфекция», занимает должность дезинструктора. 
Дополнительные средства в размере 15 000 гривен нужны Эвелине для того, чтобы отремонтировать и утеплить фасад дома пенопластом. Дело в том, что стены дома сделаны из блоков, которые достаточно холодные зимой и пропускают влагу, создавая сырость внутри помещения, а это, в свою очередь, приводит к тому, что внутри дома стены быстро портятся и осыпаются.
texts.en: Evelina is from Vynohradiv. She has a husband and two sons. Evelina works at the private company, "Profdesignfeksiya," holding the position of design instructor. Evelina needs 15000 more Hryvnia to renovate her house walls with foam insulation. The fact that the walls of her house are made of blocks, which when cold in winter absorb moisture and make the premises damp, leads to quickly deteriorating and crumbling walls in the house.

loans.use: to insulate the walls of her house

loans.name: Jayne

texts.en:
Jayne is no stranger to health issues. When she was just a teen, Jayne watched her mother battle through cancer and witnessed firsthand the often harmful effects of her mother’s medication. After losing her mother at 19, Jayne battled her own weight issues.

In 2011, after losing over 80 lbs and receiving her certification to practice natural health care, Jayne felt ready to help others attain a healthy mind, body and spirit.

As a nutritionist at her business, Infinite Profusion, Jayne focuses on homeopathic remedies and has helped patients successfully substitute their medication with nutritional alternatives. Jayne has a wide range of clients with a variety of ailments, but one of the proudest moments in her career is when her professional recommendation helped a Type 2 diabetic to stop taking insulin.

Jayne will use this loan to buy supplies and begin the development of a website.

Help Jayne help others achieve their healthiest lifestyle!

loans.use: To pay for supplies and begin development of her business's website.

loans.name: Anttonita

texts.en:
Anttonita earns a living through her retail store business in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and the mother of two children, ages 9 and 2. 

Anttonita sells various dry goods to people in her place.  She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like slippers, shirts, pants, innerwear, umbrellas, kitchenware, and other items. 

With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her products, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Anttonita hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like slippers, shirts, pants, innerwear, umbrellas, kitchenware, and other items

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her sewing business. Lydia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 34 years old, married and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Fe has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sanitary napkins, diapers, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sanitary napkins, diapers, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Veronica has been in this business for 25 years. Veronica earns more income from buy-and-sell young coconuts and bananas.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, coffee, spices, etc., for her general store.

Charita has been in this business for six years. She also earns income from food vending and rice retailing.

Charita has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, coffee, spices, etc.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 44 years old and married, with five children.

Janeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has equested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Janeth has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years, and she also earns an income from entertainment (videoke) and buying and selling frozen foods.

Janeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Katsozi

texts.en:
Katsozi lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married business lady. She sells fish at the local market, and has done this business for the last three years. The business has been feeding her and her family for the three years, and it is the only source of income for the family. 

She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy 20 kilograms of fish to sell. She hopes that in the next five years, she will be a fish supplier in town. she will use the income raised to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy 20 kilograms of fish.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a first-year student of AUCA, department of Business Administration. Here is her story.

“I can imagine the ideal person of Kyrgyzstan. It is a citizen who has a good education, sets long term goals of life. That’s how I want to be. I was dreaming about studying Business Administration (BA) at AUCA. The idea and interest of this specialty came to me when I was participating in the “Tech Age Girls” project organized by IREX. As a finalist of this project, I went to Bishkek for a two-week conference and learned a lot of useful information. This project totally changed my life and goals. During the conference, I have met with famous women leaders who achieved a lot in their life, such as deputy Shirin Aitmatova, US Ambassador to Kyrgysztan, Pamela L. Spratlen, and others. 

The idea of studying BA came to me during the course “business etiquette”. In this course I learned how business corporations work and how to behave in a business organization. In the second week of conference, I participated in a mini-internship at one of the IT companies in Kyrgyzstan. 

I want to learn more about production, how business companies use marketing to know the value of the product. In the future, I want to be a manager and a business woman in Kyrgyzstan. My ideal woman leader is Gulnara Kalikova. She is a successful business woman and I inspire her leadership skills.

During and after my studies at AUCA I want to continue helping to people by actively participating in civil society initiatives. With gained knowledge and skills from BA department I want to contribute to the development of my country.

However, I am not able to afford full tuition at AUCA. I hope to get a KIVA loan to ensure that I will not have to struggle with my finances while I pursue my degree.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Anita grows rice in her farm. She also raises pigs.

Anita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm, and animal feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augment her yield and harvest. In the future, Anita hopes to make her business a success and stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm, and animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
Rafail is 45 years old and married.  He has tthree children, and two of his children have graduated from school. 

Rafail manages planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables on his own land.  He has been involved in farming for 17 years. 

He is the only breadwinner of the family. To meet his family's everyday needs, he is working every day. His wife and elder son assist him greatly in his horticultural activities. 

To be able to continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Rafail needs a loan of AZN 1,000 to purchase seeds and  fertilizer.  He and his family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en:
Subhan is 46 years old and married. 

He has been working at his mini-market for 15 years. He started his project by selling a small quantity of food products to his neighbors and close friends, and he found it profitable and a good financial support for his family. So he opened his own mini-market, and now he wants to buy more products that his customers have requested and to buy a refrigerator, where he can keep cold drinks. 

But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan of AZN 1,500.

loans.use: to buy more food products and a refrigerator

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Trinidad native Andrew has worked in sales his whole life. So it was only natural that when he and his wife moved to the United States 15 years ago, he would continue in the field he knew and loved. Andrew found a job working in an electronic store in Queens, NY, where he gained valuable experience running a local business.

Armed with the business network he had created in Queens, Andrew decided to start his own business, Kabs, where he sells small electronics and household appliances. Andrew really enjoys helping people make their dream purchases, and since opening Kabs in 2011, he has earned the trust of local vendors and has had the opportunity to work with some of the top electronics distributors in the country.

Andrew relies on his business to support his wife and daughter, and with your generosity, he will use this loan to expand his merchandise and meet consumer demand.

Help Andrew build his inventory, expand his customer base and create a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase new electronic products and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is 29 years old and married, the mother of three children. 

Her husband owns a milk-selling business, which is the only source of income for his family. He has one buffalo for this work. He sell milk in the main market and door to door. All customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. The number of customers are increasing day by day, so he wants to increase his business. 

Therefore, Nabeela is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase another buffalo. By doing so, he will be able to increase his net income and savings. 

Nabeela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

loans.name: Demostenes Amador

texts.es:
Amador tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto sus padres en el distrito de Oyotún donde su población dedica al cultivo de arroz, yuca, y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, aves de corral y cerdos, Amador ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para mejorar las condiciones de los corrales de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor distribución de los mismos y así tener una mejor producción lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Amador is 36 years old. He lives with his parents in the Oyotún district, where the people work growing rice and yuca and raising small animals. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He works raising and selling small animals, ducks, poultry, and pigs.  Amador has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to improve the conditions of the animal pens.  In this way he will have a better arrangement, and thus will have a better production from which he will generate a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of his animal pens.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala  is 36 years old and married, with two children.

Even though her husband works for an electrical company, he makes a very low salary, which is only enough to support their family on a daily basis and provide for their basic needs. However, their home has been in urgent need of a facade for a long time now, which has not been done, due to their lack of funds.  

Kamala is requesting a loan of AZN 1,500 to purchase the building materials to construct the house facade and also to close in the balcony for winter time. 

She said that without this support, she would not be able to facade her house. This loan will help her family to have better living conditions. 

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for improving their family living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to construct a facade for her house

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo knows how to find the silver lining. After losing his grandmother, Gustavo created Cremations America in her honor and became committed to “bring peace to families that have lost a loved one.”

For four years, this Bronx native and now Florida resident, has used his two decades of experience in funeral homes to provide affordable service to families in their time of need. His daughter helps him run the business, a crucial aspect to this family man. He desires to leave behind a business and a legacy for his daughters and grandchildren to come.

By obtaining this loan, Gustavo will be able to offer a wider selection of urns to his clients and build a new quiet room where families can have the privacy to honor and respect their deceased loved ones. Help Gustavo continue providing this special service to his community.

Check out Gustavo’s  business: cremationsamerica.com

loans.use: To purchase new inventory and build additional space.

loans.name: Dastan

texts.en:
Dastan is a student in the American University of Central Asia, department of Software Engineering, and here is his story:

“My name is Dastan. I am from Almaty, Kazakhstan. I graduated Kazakh-Turkish high school this year, and enrolled in AUCA, department of Software Engineering. I consider AUCA as one of the best Universities in Central Asia, and it was long ago when one of my friends recommended me to prepare for it.

I also consider the extracurricular activities of AUCA to be very useful and interesting for students. I have worked with AIESEC as a volunteer last year. This experience was necessary both for internship abroad, and I was happy to be selected as an exchange participant. After this selection, we had a conference in Issykkul. It inspired me and I joined AIESEC as a member. I was selected as a Vice-President of incoming exchange program of global internship program in AIESEC Bishkek. I was also a member of public and relationships communication team and incoming exchange program BOOM, and worked in outgoing exchange team. 

Additionally, I took part in organizing the Development Leadership Day, Global Village, etc. One of our responsibilities was teaching children, ages 10-16, English and other languages. All the above mentioned experiences will help me be an active participant of social events of AUCA.
    
Although there is another problem – finance restrictions of my family. Kiva gives financial support to students, which is great opportunity. I would like to apply for financial aid from Kiva, and hope that my candidacy will be considered as one of the best and valuable students to join AUCA. I will try all my best to meet all AUCA requirements in all its aspect.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira graduated from the New Generation Academy of AUCA this year, and enrolled AUCA, department of Sociology.
 
Lira was one of the finalists of ACCESS Program. She was a responsible, motivated student during the whole program, and was highly respected among other students. She conducted training independently, and made very good presentations on education projects, as well as worked on social projects. 

ACCESS Program is a competitive program, and participants are from all over Kyrgyzstan. This year, 270 students have been selected, and Lira is known to be one of the honored students between 20. Lira is proficient in MS programs, such as MS Office, Moviemaker, Picaso, etc.
 
Lira also participated in “Summer School of Democracy 2012”, where she had the opportunity of meeting with senior officials. It is worth mentioning the Lira’s contribution to social project of ACCESS Program is collecting books for orphanages of Kant city. She also opened classes at American Corner where she was teaching children drawing and making presentations on great painters of the world.

All the above mentioned experiences will give her an opportunity to take an active part of social life at AUCA, and greatly make contributions to it. 
But her family cannot fully pay the tuition fees. So, Lira needs Kiva loan so that she could study without thinking about finance.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina earns a living through selling off-the-rack clothes to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and the mother of three children. 

Delfina has been in the business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 

She is asking a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like slippers, shorts, pants, and shirts, and other clothing materials. With this, she will be able to expand her stocks, thus allowing her to cater more buyers and customers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like slippers, shorts, pants, and shirts, and other clothing materials

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella is a married woman and a mother of three from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in a food vending business selling home cooked food to the people in her area. Rodella has been in this business for more than five5 years now. This is her source of her daily income.

Rodella is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. With this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food to sell, such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married and has two children. She runs a buy-and-sell business as an aid to her husband's income from working as a driver. She has been doing this for more than three years, selling cosmetics and jewelries in her community to earn a living.

She joined GDMPC this year, and borrowed a loan to purchase more cosmetic products and jewelry to resell. She plans to use her generated revenue to buy a motorcycle that can be used in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en: Erminda, 54, is married with two children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur along with her family. She has been selling banana cue in their community to make a living. Her previous loan taken from GDMPC was used in her business and was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more bananas to cook. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business and save for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a retail shop in Kangundo town. He also sells window glass, and it has been profitable. He is 41 years old, married, and, together with his spouse, blessed with two children.

He plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of window glass to sell. He will use the anticipated income from his expanded business to add more stocks of goods.

His future hopes are to educate his children and to install electricity in his house.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of window glass to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, etc., for her business. Marites has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, seasonings, etc., for her business

loans.name: Guzelia

texts.en:
Guzelia is a first-year student at AUCA in the Department of Psychology. Below is her story.

“Last year I finished my high school and I did have ideas in which university I wanted to study, but the main question was who I wanted to be in the future. During the studies in my secondary school, I never thought that I would have a chance to study in the New Generation Academy, and I got more opportunity after studying in NGA, which is also within AUCA. Studying at the Academy taught me to be brave, ambitious and never give up even when I do not succeed in something. 

During the preparation year, I studied in all-round English, Kyrgyz and Russian languages; I also studied math, history and computer. Professors prepared us for our future education at AUCA. They also helped to determine our choices of which department to choose. I also gained huge experience in analytical thinking and communication skills. Preparatory courses at AUCA gave me all the necessary knowledge to become a deserving student at AUCA.

So, I chose the Psychology Department to study and I have been asking myself many times why exactly this department. First, I enjoy working with people and helping them in solving their problems. But in the beginning, I did not have much information and knowledge on this subject. Fortunately, I took part in the presentation of the psychology department. I'll never forget this atmosphere and the moment when the professors began telling us about something new we never heard about in our life. One of the professors said: “Psychology studies the mental state of a person’s inner world. The psychologist does not cure, but helps people to find harmony, both with you and with the people around you”.

All the above-mentioned made me think about the decision that I made finally. I am sure I will manage to be one of the best students in the Psychology Department at AUCA.

There are some financial difficulties in my family though and therefore I am applying for a KIVA loan. A KIVA loan will help me to fully dedicate myself to education and not to think about the money that would cover my tuition.”

loans.use: To pay tuition fees

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a member of a three-person group, and she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's general store. 

He will be using this amount to purchase more variety for his store, like sugar, flour, rice, juices, ice cream, tea, etc. As a result, her husband will be able to provide a greater variety of products to his clients and increase his net income and savings. 

Naseem wants to live a good and simple life with her family. She wishes to renovate her house, to provide quality education to all of her children, and to fulfill all of the other basic needs of her family. She prays a lot for her children's better future and for her husband's good health. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more variety for her husband's store, like sugar, flour, rice, juices, ice cream, tea, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Victoria has an embroidery business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell in her business. Antonia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods for resale.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is a single entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling home products in her community. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to purchase more items to sell. She is hopeful that she will increase revenue and be able to use it to build a shelter where she can run the business. In the future, she wants to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more home products for resale.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is managing her own rice farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than twelve years, generating her own income in addition to her husband's. 

Maria Luz joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to cover the costs of plowing and fertilization. She hopes to earn an abundant harvest this cropping season and to be able to save a portion of her generated revenue for the education of her only child.

loans.use: to cover the costs of plowing and fertilization

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods to the people in her area of San Miguel, Bohol. Florencia is a mother of nine children.

Florencia has been in this business for more than 15 years. This is the source of her income. Florencia is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, soap, toiletries, soda and other beverages. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. In the future, Florencia hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, soap, toiletries, soda and other beverages.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 37 years old, married, and has nine children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a retail store where she sells daily-use home products. She has been in business for more than two years, and her earnings are in addition to her husband's income from farming. 

In 2011, Estrella joined GDMPC. Her previous loan, used for her business, was successfully repaid. She is now requesting a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“My name is Sultan. I have a keen interest in enrolling at the American University of Central Asia. For financial restrictions of my family, I would like to apply to the financial aid department to get financial support.
 
Human nature is arranged so that we will always seek to be the best. Also, I try to devote all my efforts to do my best. It is a well-known fact that human beings are judged by their deeds. No doubt that the most demonstrated deeds of individuals are their experiences and achievements in life. It is very often said that the amount of every person’s achievement indicates the level of his integrity. I seem to be the person of a tremendous integrity as for the amount of goals I plan to achieve is truly large.
 
However, I am very young, hence I know that the largest achievements of my life are before me. For now, my major goal is enrolling at the American University of Central Asia. I have to be perfect for it. I will put all my efforts to prove that I am really perfect for AUCA. So, I know that my future is AUCA, and I know that all the necessary knowledge and skills I will get are exactly there. I will do all my best to be a merit for AUCA.

Another company helping one to grow is living an independent life. In general, the influence of studying at AUCA is useful. To study at AUCA is not simply getting an education, but a good ability to open my mind and find my own place in this world. I hope I will get a chance to be part of its great team.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
For the last ten years, Esther has been running her business of growing wheat in Nyahururu. She has applied for her fourth loan of KES 50,000 from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy some herbicides and fertilizer to spray her wheat crop for high and quality yields.

In a good season, Teresa manages to produce wheat worth KES 100,000 and now that she expects to make even higher profits from her improved business, she intends to use it to start another business of selling clothes.

She is a 60-year-old widow and a mother of six children aged 18, 16, 14, 12,10 and 8 years old, and they are all in school.

She hopes for and dreams of a very fulfilled future.

loans.use: To buy some herbicides and fertilizer to spray the crops on her farm for high yields

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell ready to wear. Josephine is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat and other frozen products for her food vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat and other frozen products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy materials, such as linen, chalk, etc. for her tailoring business.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years, and earns more income from rice retailing.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as linen, chalk, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 52 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as biscuits, chips, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc.

Adelaida has been in this business for 26 years.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as biscuits, chips, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia works hard to support her family. Aurelia is separated and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Aurelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Aurelia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 21-year-old married man. He lives in Chiatura with his wife, brother and grandparents. His grandparents are provided with a retirement pension. George is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has three cows and a pig. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, the family owns a small piece of agricultural land where different kinds of vegetables are grown for family use. George sometimes works physically to increase the income of his family. As the income is not stable, George decided to start his own business. The Start Up program, which is the joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,300 GEL to open a fast food business. He will purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials and will start producing Donner (rolled meat). There is no such fast food business in the area and he hopes that this will be a profitable business. The Start Up loan will be a great help for the family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and raw materials to open a fast food business

loans.name: Daniz

texts.en:
Daniz is 22 year old and single. He is a hard-working man who strives to offer his parents a good life. He has been operating a home appliances business for more than two years. It is the main source of his income. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish.
 
Danis is requesting 600 AZN to stock his business with more home appliance products so his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to stock his business with more home appliance products

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is a married woman and a mother of six children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in the retail sales of bananas, sweet potatoes and other farm products. She is asking for a loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes and other farm products to sell at the market. With this, she will be able to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more at the market. She hopes to make her business a success and sustainable so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes and other farm products to sell at the market.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 3 children ages 12, 14, and 15 years old respectively. Her husband worked as a fisherman to support their family. 

She runs a store to help augment the income of their household. She sells various items like sugar, eggs, coffee, soap, noodles, cooking oil, and soft drinks. Her business started 6 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and other assorted dry goods, to maintain the inventory of her store. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other assorted dry goods

loans.name: Shonda

texts.en:
After her time in the Air Force, Shonda had a hard time finding a stable way to make a living. She found temporary work in inventory management and at a temp agency. It was only after realizing her passion for helping others that she became determined to start her own business. 

In 2008, Shonda founded "Proactive Support Solutions", a company that supports small businesses in various capacities including accounting, database management, administration, and telemarketing. By becoming an entrepreneur and starting her own business, Shonda has become the independent woman she has always aspired to be. By making her passion her profession, she is able to support herself and her two sons.

Shonda will use this loan to purchase office supplies, and, with your help, she will be one step closer to being able to expand her business.

Help Shonda build her business and provide support for her family.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies for her company that supports small businesses

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 29 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, spices, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, spices, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos en Sallique, una comunidad que se dedica al cultivo de café, arroz y maíz, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de Reparaciones Mecánica arregla motos, motores y también brinda el servicio de electrónica. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para motos, motores entre otros y con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 42 years old and lives with his wife and their six children in Sallique. The community is known for growing coffee, rice, and maize and is two hours from the city of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

The service Gilberto provides is mechanical repairs. He fixes motorcycles and engines and also works as an electrician. He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles for the purchase of parts and accessories for motorcycles, engines, etc. With these he will generate more income and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an engine and accessories for motorcycles.

loans.name: Aniana

texts.en:
Aniana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell boxes of food business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from selling ready to wear clothing and frozen foods.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of food to sell. Aniana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of food to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 47 years old and has three children. She is widowed and has three children who are in school. She is in the poultry business in the Philippines. She has been this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a new PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her poultry. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her poultry.

loans.name: Sarina

texts.en:
Sarina is 56 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, and shampoo.

Sarina has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and fruits and raising pigs.

Sarina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 2 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, and coffee.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, and coffee

loans.name: Haleema Group

texts.en:
This group is called Haleema and consists of four women. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER. Halima is the president of this group. She lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a person skilled in printing  but gets a low income that is not enough to cover her needs. However, she works hard daily, and she loves her career. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance her skills in using the computer and speed the process of doing reports for her work which will ensure better conditions for her work.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia, the leader of a two-person group, is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. Her husband owns a milk-selling business, the family's sole source of income. He sells milk from his buffalo in the main market, assisted by Shazia.  All customers like the fresh and delicious product he delivers. 

Because his monthly net income is inadequate to meet the family's needs, Shazia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can purchase another buffalo. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 56 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, chips and poultry supplies.

She has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Zenaida wants to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, chips and poultry supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds. Teresita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is 57-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of the Sachkhere district with his wife and 3 children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows and a calf. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. 

In addition, Oleg has a vineyard and a 5-hectare plot of agricultural land, where he grows maize and haricot. Oleg is a very hardworking man and always has high quality products that are sold to local retailers. 

He has a newly opened grocery and needs a minibus to supply his grocery with stock. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $5,000 for purchasing a minibus. Once the minibus is purchased, he will be able to offer a wide range of products to his clients. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed, age 35, is a mother of two children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Naheed is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. She will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

Naheed is happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of embroidery materials

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is a 59-year-old widow with one child. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Salud is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Salud has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 30-year-old young man. He lives with his mother in a small village in the Khelvachauri district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Guram is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a cow and a calf whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have land where tomatoes, cucumbers and haricots are grown.

Guram is a very hardworking man and always has high quality products which are sold to local retailers at a good price. Guram decided to start a family business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,100 laris. As he already owns commercial space, he will purchase stock and open a market with the received credit. The startup loan will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock and open a market

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been running a retail shop in Kangundo town and she has been in this business for five years now. She is 44 years old and widowed with six children. 

She plans to use this loan amount to buy a bigger stock of goods for selling. These include sugar, flour, soap, milk, and rice. She will use the anticipated profits from her extended business to educate her children.This is her sixth loan term and she paid all her previous loans successfully.

In future Josephine hopes to educate all her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ruby Jean

texts.en:
Ruby Jean is a married woman and a mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or retail store business selling various goods  to the people in her place.

Ruby Jean is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and others. With this, she will be able to improve her store thus allowing her to cater for more buyers. Ruby Jean has hopes of expanding her store in the future and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, sodas and other beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and others

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a married man and father of six children from San Miguel, Bohol. He earns a living through charcoal sales. Timoteo has been in the business for more than nine years now.

Timoteo is asking for a loan to buy more coconut shells for charcoal making. With this,  he will be able to make more charcoal thus allowing him to sell more in the market. In the future, Timoteo has hopes of making his business a success and sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Tropia Group

texts.en:
Maua who is in her mid 20s is single with one daughter who is still at school. She has been running a grocery store for two years now.  She works from 3.00 am until after midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Maua's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more drinks and especially the types which are in demand.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees for her child and household expenses.  She saved some money in her bank account. She will use this loan to start selling food in her grocery. She dreams of being a international business woman.

Maua will share this loan with her loan group "Tropia"  which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling food in her grocery.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Aida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Dadilyn

texts.en:
Dadilyn works hard to support her family. Dadilyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Dadilyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other materials. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Dadilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Sala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sala and consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Safa is a 27-year-old married woman. Her husband is an employee with a monthly salary which he uses to support his family. Safa tries her best to assist her husband in covering what her family needs. 

She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a fridge to use in her house. She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge to use in her house.

loans.name: Abagamba Kamwe Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 46-year-old woman and a widow with seven children aged 28, 26, 24, 22,18,16 and 14 respectively. Three of them attend school and she is in charge of paying tuition for them and providing their basic needs. She is a farmer as well as a produce trader and has been doing this since 2000 as a major source of income to support her family.

Grace borrowed 300,000 UGX previously to expand her business, which she was able to do, so now she has applied for 700,000 UGX to buy more produce so that she can earn increased profits. 

Her dreams include, among others, seeing all her children finish school and building a family house, but her biggest challenge is limited capital, price fluctuations and bad weather, which affects business sometimes.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to sell.

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Alli, who is in his mid-40s, is married with two daughters, one of whom is still at school and the other one has finished school. He has been running a business collecting scrappers and selling firewood for three years now. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Alli's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more scrappers and more firewood. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his stock of scrappers and firewood. He dreams of building his own house.

Alli will share this loan with his loan group "Mbogo". The five members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of scrappers and firewood.

loans.name: Mirvari

texts.en: Mirvari is 60 years of age. She   has been selling blankets for  40 years. She started her project with a small amount of her products and found it a good source of income. Now she wants to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of blankets to make better profit and to earn better income to support herself and her family in improving their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for   a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of blankets so as to make better profit

loans.name: Kimratvannak

texts.en:
Kimratvannak (in the photo), age 19, is single and lives with his parents and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His parents sell noodles with soup.
 
Kimratvannak has just finished his baccalaureate and he wants to continue his studies in Electrical Engineering at the university. Hence he decided to apply for a loan to pay his school fees.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and to pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
This is Juditha. She previously accessed a PHP 22,000 loan that she used buy more quantities of products, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to purchase ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juditha hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of having a long life. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 31 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy household goods like chips, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Jemma wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods like chips, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 42 years old and has five children. Flordeliza is married and has two children who are in school.

Flordeliza is in the agricultural business pig-fattening in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Flordeliza has been pig-fattening for 24 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Gloria has been in this business for five years. Gloria earns additional income from food vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Herminia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, eggs, etc for her restaurant business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, eggs, etc

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and married with six children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, noodles, spices, eggs, etc.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jessica aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, noodles, spices, eggs, etc

loans.name: Sarmad

texts.en:
Sarmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 28 years of age who is married and has a child. Sarmad lives with four family members of whom three are employed.

Sarmad has owned a children’s clothing store since 2010. He has good experience in what he practices and has a deep understanding of customers' needs and a good reputation, and he is well-known in his surroundings. Due to the workload, Sarmad has a hired employee.

Sarmad is applying for a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and she also earns income from farming bananas.  Maricel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

Maricel has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.en:
Aigerim is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is her story.

“My name is Aigerim. I am from Bishkek, Kazakhstan. I graduated from high-school this year and enrolled the American University of Central Asia. 
Since I have been at elementary school I have tried to participate in all social events within the school and out of it. In 9th grade I became a volunteer at the Tourist Information Center. I got a huge experience in working with foreigners. I have also participated in the contest 'Stolypin reforms' on behalf of the school, which was organized by the Kyrgyz-Russian Slavic University. I won second place and was awarded an encyclopedia. In the same year I represented our school in the district Olympiad of English language and won 3rd place. At another event, conducted by the International University of Kyrgyzstan, our team took second place. The competition was on developing a business plan. I was awarded a certificate for making presentations at the 'Science nourish young' festival, dedicated to the 300th Anniversary of the university. 

I am happy to enroll in AUCA, but unfortunately my family is not able to cover the tuition fees fully. I hope to get a Kiva loan, so that I can concentrate on my studies rather than thinking about finance.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Ceclia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in Kilifi, a town north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 28 years old and married, with one child.  

She runs a retail business that deals in cosmetics and women's clothing. She started the business five years ago from personal savings she had made. 

She wants to buy handbags, clothes, jewelery, and shoes for sale in her business. She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join so that she could save and be able to access credit for her business. The challenges in her business are price changes, inflation, and customers failing to pay their debts in time. 

She will use the income that she raises from the business to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy handbags, clothes, jewelery, and shoes

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José de 73 años, es un hombre trabajador a pesar de su avanzada edad, tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante con su desempeño en las ventas. Actualmente, vive en la casa de su sobrino suyo, ya que desde hace 5 años decidió salir del pueblo, para vivir en la ciudad.

José se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios y venta de comida, desde el año 2012, generando desarrollo a otras personas, ya que cuenta con 2 empleadas. La experiencia en esta actividad, la adquirió viendo algunos amigos que administraban negocios y a José le nació la idea de instalar su negocio y es así como hoy tiene su negocio en asocio con otro compañero.  

Con el préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más productos alimenticios  y así cubrir con más eficiencia el mercado de la ciudad, ya que pronto se acercan las fiestas patronales y es una buena época, para la venta de comida y productos varios.
José quiere tener un negocio más grande,  en un futuro no muy lejano, para dejarle a su familia un buen negocio y así lo administren ellos.
texts.en:
José is 73 years old, and a hard working man in spite of his advanced age. He has a strong desire to do well in his sales. He currently lives in his nephew's home, as he left his village 5 years ago to live in the city.

José has been earning a living by selling food products since 2012, and has helped other people develop skills: he now has two employees. He learned this business by watching some friends who run businesses, and then had the idea to set up his own business; his business is set up in association with another colleague. 

With the loan that José is requesting from Fundación Campo, he will buy more food products and thus meet the demands of the market. The festival for the patron saint is approaching and this will be a good time for sales of food and other various products.

José wants to expand his business in the future, and wants to leave it to his family to run.

loans.use: to buy more food products, and thus meet the demands of the market: the festival for the patron saint is approaching and this will be a good time for sales of food and other various products.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is aged 33; she helps her parents in trying to improve their poor living conditions. According to her, she has already spent six months in her hog-fattening business. During that time, Jackielyn has found it to be a good source of income. 

Now, she wants to expand her business through asking a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins. She hopes to make a profit out of her loan in order to save for their future use.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat like wood, paint, bamboo, etc for her fishing/fish vending business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 12 years. Erlinda earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat like wood, paint and bamboo.

loans.name: Fathi Hussein

texts.en:
Fadhi Hussein is 20 years old. He studies at the University of Hargeisa, faculty of medicine. His main challenge is the lack of a laptop to prepare university assignments and read the lessons when given in soft copy. 

He approached Kaaba Micro-finance Institution for a laptop. Now he is waiting for the laptop and Kaaba will provide the laptop, which he can pay for in monthly repayments. After finishing university, Fathi wants to work as a Doctor.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Salamorin

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salamorin works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Salamorin is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Salamorin has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is from Iraq. He is 44 years old and married, with three children. Hamzeh and his eldest child work to provide the family income together.

Hamzeh owns a small shop in his neighborhood, where he sells fresh fruits and vegetables. He has a high reputation in the area and has many daily customers. He has been in this field since 2010, and now he has already hired two employees.

Hamzeh is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. The aim of this loan is to expand his shop and to increase his inventory. 

Hamzeh is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may provide better income for his family.

loans.use: to expand his shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Juana es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de rosquilla, desde hace unos 30 años.
Doña Juana tiene su negocio su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de harina, maíz, azúcar, soda, etc. para tener más productos para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Juana con el préstamo espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y gracias a esta inversión espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Juana espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en los diferentes problemas económicos que se les presenten.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Juana is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives together with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. Her business since 30 years back is selling donuts. Juana runs her business in her house in the community where she lives. She needs this loan in order to buy flour, corn, sugar, baking soda, etc. so that she can produce more in order to continue her work, which gives her a big part of her income. 

Juana hopes that this loan will help her to increase her sales, since she doesn't possess the necessary inputs to deliver her clients' daily orders. Thanks to this investment she hopes that she will be able to improve her family's quality of life by increasing the income of the household.

Juana hopes to make her business grow in the not-so-distant future and thus be able to continue supporting her family through the different economic hardships that might appear.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, sugar, baking soda, etc

loans.name: Dadilyn

texts.en:
Dadilyn works hard to support her family. Dadilyn is married and has a buying and selling banana business in the Philippines.

Dadilyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

Dadilyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Dadilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
